issueDTO.title: [Feature]: Support EPLB for More MoE Models, e.g. Qwen 3, Llama 4
issueDTO.description:
### 🚀 The feature, motivation and pitch

🎉 **#18343 introduces dynamic Expert Parallelism Load Balancing (EPLB)** for DeepSeek-V2/V3/R1 models.

As MoE (Mixture-of-Experts) models become more common, we???d love help extending EPLB support to other MoE models???such as Qwen3, Llama 4, and more.

This is a great **first good issue** for anyone interested in model internals or systems work. #18343 was built with generality in mind, so extending it to other models or quantization methods should be relatively straightforward.

---

### ??? How to add support for a new model

Implement the `MixtureOfExperts` protocol. Specifically, you???ll need to:

- Expose relevant MoE configuration flags.
- Provide access to expert weights for EPLB to rearrange.
- Forward EPLB-related arguments into the `FusedMoE` layer.

📌 **Note on weight loading:**  
For models with **redundant experts**, you???ll need to carefully adjust the weight loading logic. `FusedMoE` returns an `expert_params_mapping` that reflects expert duplication, but you may need to modify the model class to ensure correct loading behavior.

🔎 Example: See how it???s done in [`deepseek_v2.py`](https://github.com/vllm-project/vllm/pull/18343/files#diff-420f1cd67991a63cb419ca0e00e6f42cbe825864d0541e0662eeed2f9ddbd021).

---

### ??? How to add support for quantized models

This is usually even easier???just make sure EPLB-related arguments are properly forwarded in your quantization path.

🔎 Example: See [`fp8.py`](https://github.com/vllm-project/vllm/pull/18343/files#diff-5511bfcc9c53f7d96517ad43e4087f6777bef21302da983f42cafae40a866644) for a minimal working change.

---

👋 **Want to contribute?**

We???d love your help in extending EPLB support! Feel free to comment below or open a draft PR???we???re happy to guide you through the process.

### Alternatives

_No response_

### Additional context

_No response_

### Before submitting a new issue...

- [x] Make sure you already searched for relevant issues, and asked the chatbot living at the bottom right corner of the [documentation page](https://docs.vllm.ai/en/latest/), which can answer lots of frequently asked questions.
comments: Amazing! I am happy to work with EPLB-Qwen3 support.
@abmfy What models do we need to implement EPLB???
@abmfy Love to contribute . can u assign me this task ?
@abmfy, I would love to help work on some models.
claimed
I can work with Qwen3 EPLB support
I would like to contribute!

Hi everyone, thanks a lot for your enthusiasm and support ??? really appreciated! And sorry for the delayed response, I was on a flight.

Since @aladerran  was the first to reply, I???ll go ahead and assign you to the EPLB support for Qwen-3 ??? thanks for picking it up!

For others who are interested: I did a quick search for models using the `FusedMoE` class under `vllm.model_executor.models`, and found the following files:

- `aria.py`
- `dbrx.py`
- `dots1.py`
- `ernie45_moe.py`
- `granitemoe.py`
- `grok1.py`
- `hunyuan_v1_moe.py`
- `jamba.py`
- `kimi_vl.py`
- `llama4.py`
- `minimax_text_01.py`
- `mistral.py`
- `olmoe.py`
- `phimoe.py`
- `qwen2_moe.py`
- `qwen3_moe.py`

However, note that EPLB mainly benefits multi-node setups, and especially models that **weren???t** trained with expert load-balancing loss (like DeepSeek-V3, though this kind of models are not many nowadays). So we may not need to support every model above.

That said, Qwen-3, Llama 4, and MiniMax-01 are probably the highest priority given their size and practical relevance ??? but support for other MoE models is also very welcome!

There???s also the `DeepSeekMTP` model, which is a bit special. It's used for speculative decoding and follows a different code path. I haven't yet checked whether it uses the same expert parallel config as the main model, but if it does, EPLB might be applicable there too. Contributions in that direction would be appreciated as well.

Let me know if anyone wants to take a specific model ??? happy to help guide where needed!
Hi @abmfy , I would like to take Llama4. Thanks!
@abmfy , i would like to contribute on mistral.py
Hey @abmfy , I would like to take MiniMax-01. Thank you!
Hi @abmfy, I'd like to contribute on Grok-1. Thank you!

issueDTO.title: Whitelist "Focus" Mode
issueDTO.description:
<!--
(Click PREVIEW to undestand this template) 
               OPTIONALLY fill the table if each point fits in the same line: 
-->

??? _PROBLEM_: I need a way to keep myself from getting sidetracked by distracting videos on YouTube. I've lost track of how many times I've gone to YouTube to study or learn and end up falling down a rabbit hole of interesting but unhelpful content.
<!-- (Does your IDEA / feature request relate to a Problem? Which problem is? 
           Ex. I'm always frustrated when [...] )-->

??? _SOLUTION_:    A "focus mode" comparing data like tags and descriptions to a user-defined whitelist. If say I'm logging on to YouTube to study 3D modeling techniques, I just need to fill a whitelist with appropriate keywords [Modeling, Blender, Maya, UV Mapping, Weight Painting, etc]. When I pull up a video, the extension will check to see if the description, tags (or perhaps even the transcript) has any words that match with the whitelist. If it does not, the video is **blocked** and I've been saved from an unscheduled binge-watch of video essays on the Spanish conquest of Central America. 
<!-- (Describe what you'd like 
          (A clear and concise description of what you want to happen). 
           Please consider screenshots or sketches if it makes sense)-->

 ??? _ALTERNATIVES_: None
<!-- (Describe what you've considered: 
      Alternative solutions or features, you'd consider as equal or inferior). -->

 ??? _RELEVANCE / SCOPE_: I could imagine at least 25% of users finding this useful. Users with ADHD, poor impulse control, or just want to study would want this feature.
<!-- (Would this be good by for everybody by default? (hypothetically). 
          Estimate how many percent of our users (or all youtube users) should/would use your idea? ) -->

??? _"SIDE EFFECTS"_:   None. It's a toggleable feature
<!-- (Is there any conflict with any other feature? 
           Who might NOT want this?(How many percent of users could be bothered by it even filling space in our menu?)--> 

??? _CONTEXT_:   The YouTube algorithm is specifically engineered to steer users towards "engaging" content and the creators of said content are incentivized to make their videos hook the viewer within the first 15 seconds. It is a nightmare for the easily distracted like myself.  <!-- any other context. -->
// 
 Thank  you!

SHORT Table | (Summary)     
------------ | -------------   
*Problem*     |  YouTube tries to get you to watch videos unrelated to why you logged on.                                 
*Solution*     |  A feature that checks if a video contains keywords on a whitelist and stops any that don't from playing.                                                         <!-- TYPE HERE, 1 line each) -->         
*Alternatives*|  None       
*Scope*         |   25%        
*Side effects*|   None     
*Context*      | Despite having all the best learning materials, YouTube is designed to distract rather than educate.

issueDTO.title: --no-web Packaging Option
issueDTO.description:
### Is there an existing proposal for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing proposals

### Is your feature request related to a problem?

I have an issue utilizing the flamegraph and table output options when using memray on an airgapped system. Since the system does not have internet access, connecting to the CDNs to get the javascript is not possible and the web pages aren't fully loaded.

### Describe the solution you'd like

I would like it if memray would in a `--no-web` packaging option that would include the necessary html/css/js files as part of memray and have the the generated html to point accordingly.

### Alternatives you considered

Putting the files on the air gapped system and changing the links the html to point to the local file system path.
comments: I'd like to take the task of making a PR for this but am a little lost on how to best go about funneling it through to ultimately make say a conda package that has this option

Honestly, I'm not sure what work is required here either. The biggest part of any PR here is likely figuring out exactly what files are fetched dynamically by our flame graphs as they exist today (using the developer tools of the browser should be able to get us this), and then figuring out what would be involved in vendoring a copy of those into the Memray repo. Once we have a vendored copy of each of those dependencies, it should "just" be a matter of exposing a switch that changes whether our Jinja templates include URLs linking to external resources or include the contents of those resources directly.

If we find that some of these dependencies are difficult to vendor, or have licenses that are incompatible with us vendoring them instead of loading them dynamically, this might be a nonstarter.

Flamegraph report:

Bootstrap - MIT License - https://github.com/twbs/bootstrap/blob/main/LICENSE
JQuery - MIT License - https://jquery.org/license
Lodash - MIT License - https://lodash.com/license
plotly.js - MIT license - https://github.com/plotly/plotly.js/blob/master/LICENSE
popper.js(now Floating UI) - MIT License - https://github.com/floating-ui/floating-ui/blob/v2.x/LICENSE.md
d3 - ISC License - https://github.com/d3/d3/blob/main/LICENSE
d3-flamegraph - Apache License 2.0 - https://github.com/spiermar/d3-flame-graph/blob/master/LICENSE
d3-scale-chromatic - Not clear - https://github.com/d3/d3-scale-chromatic/blob/main/LICENSE
d3-tip - MIT License - https://github.com/caged/d3-tip/blob/master/LICENSE

Table report:

Datatables - MIT License - https://datatables.net/license/mit
I have a prototype solution ready for this issue. Can I go ahead and submit a PR? If possible, could anyone assign this issue to me?

> could anyone assign this issue to me?

Done

> Can I go ahead and submit a PR?

Go ahead! Bear in mind that it may take a bit more than normal for us to review the PR because we need to review more carefully the vending code due to licensing and other aspects.

> Flamegraph report:
> 
> Bootstrap - MIT License - https://github.com/twbs/bootstrap/blob/main/LICENSE JQuery - MIT License - https://jquery.org/license Lodash - MIT License - https://lodash.com/license plotly.js - MIT license - https://github.com/plotly/plotly.js/blob/master/LICENSE popper.js(now Floating UI) - MIT License - https://github.com/floating-ui/floating-ui/blob/v2.x/LICENSE.md d3 - ISC License - https://github.com/d3/d3/blob/main/LICENSE d3-flamegraph - Apache License 2.0 - https://github.com/spiermar/d3-flame-graph/blob/master/LICENSE d3-scale-chromatic - Not clear - https://github.com/d3/d3-scale-chromatic/blob/main/LICENSE d3-tip - MIT License - https://github.com/caged/d3-tip/blob/master/LICENSE
> 
> Table report:
> 
> Datatables - MIT License - https://datatables.net/license/mit

It looks like 

[d3-scale-chromatic](https://github.com/d3/d3-scale-chromatic/tree/main) has a license now

Maybe we could just always use a locally provided version then?
@godlygeek WDYT?
I think that'd be fine. We might want to check what effect that has as on the size of the generated flame graphs, but it ought to be minimal, I expect.

issueDTO.title: AwaitMessageTriggerFunctionSensor Throwing Error on apply_function (NO MODULE NAME FOUND)
issueDTO.description:
### Apache Airflow Provider(s)

apache-kafka

### Versions of Apache Airflow Providers

apache-airflow-providers-apache-kafka  -  1.8.1

### Apache Airflow version

2.10.5

### Operating System

Linux

### Deployment

Official Apache Airflow Helm Chart

### Deployment details

I'm using the Airflow Helm Chart with airflowVersion: "2.10.5" and executor: "LocalExecutor".
Also, the dags are part of externally mounted PVC. 

### What happened

Getting ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'kafka_sensor_jira'.
File Name: kafka_sensor_jira

### What you think should happen instead

It should have worked because it works fine on my local docker system. The only change here I see is the external PVC which consists of the DAG files.


### How to reproduce

For the below code, create a DAG file name as kafka_sensor_jira.py, and just run the DAG, it throws error saying no module kafka_sensor_jira
Code:

```
from airflow import DAG
from airflow.decorators import dag
from airflow.providers.apache.kafka.sensors.kafka import (
    AwaitMessageTriggerFunctionSensor,
)
from airflow.operators.trigger_dagrun import TriggerDagRunOperator
from pendulum import datetime
# from helpers import listen_function
import json
import random
import string
import sys
import os
from pathlib import Path

TOPIC_NAME = "graphdb_jira"


def _generate_uuid():
    letters = string.ascii_lowercase
    return "".join(random.choice(letters) for i in range(6))


with DAG(
    dag_id="kafka_sensor_jira_dag",
    start_date=datetime(2025, 3, 17),
    schedule_interval=None,  # This DAG runs continuously
    catchup=False,
):

    def listen_function(message):
        val = json.loads(message.value().decode("utf-8"))
        # Process the message here if needed
        return val

    def trigger_downstream_dag(message, **context):
        TriggerDagRunOperator(
            trigger_dag_id="kafka_consumer_jira_dag",
            task_id=f"kafka_sensor_jira{_generate_uuid()}",
        ).execute(context)
    
    await_message_sensor = AwaitMessageTriggerFunctionSensor(
        task_id="kafka_sensor_jira",
        topics=[TOPIC_NAME],
        apply_function="kafka_sensor_jira.listen_function",
        kafka_config_id="kafka_default_jira",
        event_triggered_function=trigger_downstream_dag,
    )
```

### Anything else

_No response_

### Are you willing to submit PR?

- [ ] Yes I am willing to submit a PR!

### Code of Conduct

- [x] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://github.com/apache/airflow/blob/main/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md)

summary.otherNotes: The issue is about AwaitMessageTriggerFunctionSensor throwing an error on apply_function (NO MODULE NAME FOUND) in an Apache Airflow DAG. The error occurs when the DAG is run on a remote environment (Helm Chart) but not on a local docker system. The DAG file is part of an externally mounted PVC. The issue is related to the Kafka provider and the error is ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'kafka_sensor_jira'.

comments:
# :wave: Important: PLEASE READ :wave:

This issue has been labeled as a **good first issue** and is available for anyone to work on.

If this is your first time contributing to an open source project, some aspects of the development process may seem unusual, arcane, or some combination of both.

1.  **You cannot "claim" issues.** People new to open source often want to "claim" or be assigned an issue before beginning work. The typical rationale is that people want to avoid wasted work in the event that someone else ends up working the issue. However, this practice is not effective in open source, as it often leads to "issue squatting", in which an individual asks to be assigned, is granted their request, and then never ends up working on the issue. Accordingly, you are encouraged to communicate your intent to address this issue, ideally by providing a rough outline as to how you plan to address the issue or asking clarifying questions, but, at the end of the day, we will take running code and rough consensus in order to move forward quickly.

issueDTO.title: `CompoundSprite` should support blending
issueDTO.description:
`CompoundSprite` does not modify child sprite `rgba` values.

It seems reasonable that it should, for example setting a `CompoundSprite` `a` value to `0` with the "default/normal" mode could hide all of the child sprites.

This would ultimately need to be implemented in [`CompoundSprite#draw_override`](https://github.com/danhealy/dragonruby-zif/blob/0f4ad63967df7872d085643a583b8c0e87cfbe23/lib/zif/compound_sprite.rb#L159-L162)

Going down that path implies implementing all of the blend modes a standard sprite supports as well.

See [sprite blending in the dragonruby docs](https://docs.dragonruby.org/static/docs.html#----sprites-) and this [wikipedia article on blend modes](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Blend_modes)

repository.name: dragonruby-zif

summary.attemptedFixes: None mentioned in the description or comments.
summary.otherNotes: The issue is related to sprite blending in DragonRuby, with references to the DragonRuby docs and a Wikipedia article on blend modes.

issueDTO.title: Environment Name UI option can't be changed when environment name already in configuration
issueDTO.description:
### Describe the issue

There seems to be no way to remove an environment name after one has been added.

To reproduce, go to Settings, Theme Preferences and then Environment Name. If I manually remove or press the `x` to clear it, it resets when the save button is pressed. If you type a new name in, it will save that.


https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/1814cb0c-c627-4b87-813e-bad633baa0e8

### Environment

- Kestra Version: `develop`
comments:
Also very interestingly, if I change the name to something else, save, then remove it, it goes back to `dev` aka what it was originally.

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/e3a80eba-667f-482a-a065-0025e07136d8

**Hey,**

I tried to reproduce this issue in my local environment by following the steps mentioned:

> Go to **Settings ??? Theme Preferences ??? Environment Name ??? clear the name and press Save**.

But it seems to be working correctly on my end ??? the environment name is successfully removed after clearing the field and saving.

I also tested the follow-up behavior you mentioned:

> _"If I change the name to something else, save, then remove it, it goes back to `dev` (what it was originally).???_

In my case, even this works fine ??? the environment name gets cleared and doesn???t revert to any default or previous value like `dev`.

Let me know if there's anything specific I might be missing. Happy to test further!

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/9912c367-ebdc-451b-8b05-d0c50c54e7c2

I had this in my Kestra configuration that I didn't realise:
```yaml
          environment:
            name: dev
```

This does beg the question whether the UI option should be removed if it's set in the configuration. I am not a typical user as I have 15+ Docker Compose configs with Kestra so easily gloss over minor differences but does make the UI option fairly redundant and confusing like I found myself in.

Thanks for the clarification ??? that makes sense now.

I also tested this by setting environment.name in my docker compose file.

```yaml
environment:
  name: dev
```
In this Setup:

- I wasn???t able to fully remove the environment name from the UI ??? it would fall back to the configured value.

- But I was able to change it in the UI, and the new value persisted ??? effectively overriding the config.

So the behavior does seem correct in the sense that the config acts as a default, and the UI allows you to override it if needed. That flexibility probably makes sense for certain setups.

That said, I do think it could be a bit confusing at first. Instead of removing the field, maybe we could add a "reset to default" option or a small tooltip/note to indicate that the value is coming from the config.

summary.otherNotes: The issue seems to be caused by the environment name being set in the configuration, which makes the UI option redundant and confusing. The behavior is correct in the sense that the config acts as a default and the UI allows overriding it, but it could be improved with a 'reset to default' option or a tooltip to indicate the value is coming from the config.

issueDTO.title: DO_SET_ROI_LOCATION and DO_SET_ROI_NONE "gimbal device id" fields should be supported
issueDTO.description:
AP supports the  [DO_SET_ROI_LOCATION](https://mavlink.io/en/messages/common.html#MAV_CMD_DO_SET_ROI_LOCATION) and [DO_SET_ROI_NONE](https://mavlink.io/en/messages/common.html#MAV_CMD_DO_SET_ROI_NONE) as "immediate" and mission commands but we do not correctly consume "param1" ("Gimbal device ID").  Instead it is always the first camera gimbal that is controlled.  We should consume this field and control the gimbal device specified

PR https://github.com/ArduPilot/ardupilot/pull/29567 added mission support for these commands
comments:
Hi @rmackay9, 
I'm currently working on this issue and have been exploring how to support the gimbal_device_id field for DO_SET_ROI_LOCATION and DO_SET_ROI_NONE. It looks like handle_command_do_gimbal_manager_pitchyaw in AP_Mount already makes use of the gimbal ID field. Should the ROI handling (set_roi_target) also use the same gimbal selection logic as handle_command_do_gimbal_manager_pitchyaw?
I'd appreciate any guidance you can provide.
Hi @G1-k, thanks for looking into this.  yes, I think the do-set-roi-location and do-set-roi-none should consume the gimbal id field in the same way as do-gimbal-manage-pitchyaw handler.  thanks!

issueDTO.title: Base use case: time tracking
issueDTO.description:
### Role
White collar contractor (e.g. software developer)

### Task
How can we enable contractors to track their time in their existing spreadsheet software which they use to track their time, and then copy the data to the web app from which they get paid?

This involves:

- Microsoft Excel or Google Sheets
- Any time tracking software (e.g. Harvest)

### Context 
Time tracking and invoicing

### Workflow
1. open Spreadsheet (e.g. Excel, Google Sheets)
2. open App (e.g. Harvest)
3. switch to Spreadsheet
4. copy first cell
5. switch to App
6. paste first cell
7. repeat steps 4-6 while necessary
8. scroll and repeat 4-7 if necessary

Ideally, there is some sort of data transformation beyond action-for-action replay that needs to happen, e.g. clicking a checkbox in the App rather than typing.

### Motivation

Simplest economically useful task
comments:
Hi, I am new to this repository.
I am interested in this issue as it seems to be a good isssue for a starter.
If it is still up for contribution, kindly assign the task to me.
Thank you.

@smilingprogrammer thank you for your interest! I've assigned the task to you.

Please let me know if you need any help getting started!

issueDTO.title: Define default-value constructors for various Wasm types in the host API
issueDTO.description:
We already have code to create default values in order to implement https://docs.rs/wasmtime/latest/wasmtime/struct.Linker.html#method.define_unknown_imports_as_default_values

We have duplicates of that code in the fuzzing utility crate: https://github.com/bytecodealliance/wasmtime/blob/main/crates/fuzzing/src/oracles/dummy.rs

We should just expose those constructors in the public API of the `wasmtime` crate, move the various fuzzing oracles over to these methods, and then delete 95% of that `wasmtime_fuzzing::oracles::dummy` module.

I am thinking that we will want to expose these as `pub fn default_value(&self, store: impl AsContextMut) -> Option<T>` methods on `wasmtime::{ExternType,GlobalType,MemoryType,ValType,...}` where `T` is `wasmtime::Memory` for the `wasmtime::MemoryType` method, etc...
comments:
Hi all,

I???ve traced through `crates/wasmtime/src/runtime/types.rs` and can confirm that all five `default_value` constructors are already exposed in the public API:

- `ExternType::default_value(&self, store) -> Result<Extern>`
- `GlobalType::default_value(&self, store) -> Result<RuntimeGlobal>`
- `MemoryType::default_value(&self, store) -> Result<RuntimeMemory>`
- `TableType::default_value(&self, store) -> Result<RuntimeTable>`
- `FuncType::default_value(&self, store) -> Result<Func>`

This is my first issue in Wasmtime, and I???d love your suggestions and input on what to do next in this PR:

- Are there any missing corner-case tests you???d like me to add?  
- Should I draft an example or update docs to showcase these APIs?  
- Is there anything else I can improve or clean up before we close this issue?

Looking forward to your guidance???thanks for your help!

issueDTO.title: Development console flicker
issueDTO.description:
### The issue

The prompt/widget area of the development console flickers when it re-draws. While on the surface this appears to be purely aesthetic, this flicker makes the console look a bit less stable, which might cause users to worry about missing log messages, which is not fun.

### Possible solutions

The following solutions are not mutually exclusive, and are in the order that it makes sense to apply them in:

- don't update if nothing changed (relatively easy, highest gain)
- compute more before drawing

### Caught in Action
#### Most of the time
![image](https://github.com/HeyPuter/puter/assets/7225168/2407e299-3015-4b15-b246-f6f362d77b67)
#### Briefly, during a re-draw

issueDTO.title: JS debugging: dragging the increment mode number field sometimes jumps at the start
issueDTO.description:
This has happened for a long time, but I should really file an issue, so here it is. It seems to probably happen more commonly in Chrome, and it seems to be harder to reproduce in Firefox (I wasn't able to reproduce it in FF in my testing right now, @0HyperCube mentions in the comments below that he has encountered it in FF). See `NumberInput.svelte`.

When you click and drag a number input field of the increment (not range) style, meaning the kind you can drag infinitely left or right, it will sometimes teleport the value to a wildly different value from the one it started with. This can be reproduced by drawing a rectangle and dragging left and right on its stroke weight parameter in the Properties panel repeatedly in quick, small left and right drags until occasionally it will make a big jump.

I hypothesize this is caused by weirdness in the event ordering and mouse position reporting with the [pointer lock](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Pointer_Lock_API) API, and it might be related to the widget being broken in Safari: #2038. I recommend logging the values that are being reported by the API and current state every frame to narrow down when the events occur and produce the discrepancy.

At the the 4-second mark in this video, we see it jump from `131.3` to `17.3` immediately when the click-and-drag begins:

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/61b1b1e6-4560-4555-aac5-f7b54cbfacb9
comments: I also sometimes get this on firefox nightly.

issueDTO.title: [Feature Request] User Labels/comments for channels
issueDTO.description:
There are lots of channels that when I look at them I consider "possible AI or vtube Clipper" channels but turn out to be official channels. When I view recommendations I'll often see them pop up from time to time and wonder "have I seen this channel before?" and have. There are channels like DarkFluff that aren't AI Reddit readers I don't want to block, he's just a guy who puts his own spin on reddit stories.

What I would really like is a way to have a comment icon next to the channel name where I can input a message for that channel. Something like: "Not AI" or "Official channel". Something to remind myself that I've looked into the channel or video before.
comments:
Hi :) Annoying AI channels will have bad feedback too, will they?
 
You might not want to tidy up youtube on your own, for only one user. 
When we can do:
-smart analysis https://github.com/code-charity/youtube/issues/1451
-crowdsourcing

(And these top 5000 https://github.com/code-charity/youtube/issues/514#issuecomment-686647128  
are around for several years and probably still a significant percentage of all youtube views.  And so on)

Crowdsourcing channel comments could be nice but would require moderation of some kind. Bad actors can abuse or overwrite with drama or lies. Keeping a ledger on your personal computer could be a first step toward crowdsourcing comments later. The smart analysis and skip ability are things that other addons like SponsorBlock are already doing. While my suggestion is basically just a channel note. Example:

>  smart analysis and skip ability are things that other addons like SponsorBlock are already doing

more than sponsor ads?

> Crowdsourcing channel comments could be nice but would require moderation of some kind

voting

issueDTO.title: This plugin is adding a very noticeable amount of delay when opening a new shell session
issueDTO.description:
Hi,

I started to use this plugin recently and I noticed my shell sessions are taking quite a bit longer to open up. I've profiled a few things and here's the numbers.

Here are the 4 zsh plugins I use with the profiling features enabled:

```sh
zmodload zsh/zprof

. "${XDG_DATA_HOME}/fast-syntax-highlighting/fast-syntax-highlighting.plugin.zsh"
. "${XDG_DATA_HOME}/zsh-autosuggestions/zsh-autosuggestions.zsh"
. "${XDG_DATA_HOME}/zsh-vi-mode/zsh-vi-mode.plugin.zsh"
. "${XDG_DATA_HOME}/fzf-tab/fzf-tab.plugin.zsh"

zprof
```

### Here's zprof with all 4 plugins enabled:

```sh
num  calls                time                       self            name
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1)    1          21.57    21.57   74.93%     21.57    21.57   74.93%  zvm_exist_command
 2)    1           4.12     4.12   14.32%      4.12     4.12   14.32%  _zsh_highlight_bind_widgets
 3)    1           2.21     2.21    7.69%      2.21     2.21    7.69%  enable-fzf-tab
 4)    2           0.31     0.15    1.06%      0.31     0.15    1.06%  add-zsh-hook
 5)    1           0.22     0.22    0.78%      0.22     0.22    0.78%  is-at-least
 6)    1           0.16     0.16    0.56%      0.16     0.16    0.56%  (anon) [/home/nick/.local/share/zsh-autosuggestions/zsh-autosuggestions.zsh:460]
 7)    1           0.12     0.12    0.42%      0.12     0.12    0.42%  (anon) [/home/nick/.local/share/fzf-tab/fzf-tab.zsh:398]
 8)    1           0.04     0.04    0.13%      0.04     0.04    0.13%  -fast-highlight-fill-option-variables
 9)    1           0.03     0.03    0.12%      0.03     0.03    0.12%  (anon) [/home/nick/.local/share/fast-syntax-highlighting/fast-highlight:35]
```

My end to end time is ~140ms:

```sh
$ time zsh -i -c exit
zsh -i -c exit  0.03s user 0.02s system 41% cpu 0.140 total
```

### Here's zprof except I commented out this plugin:

```sh
num  calls                time                       self            name
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1)    1           4.27     4.27   55.94%      4.27     4.27   55.94%  _zsh_highlight_bind_widgets
 2)    1           2.46     2.46   32.19%      2.46     2.46   32.19%  enable-fzf-tab
 3)    2           0.30     0.15    3.93%      0.30     0.15    3.93%  add-zsh-hook
 4)    1           0.24     0.24    3.14%      0.24     0.24    3.14%  is-at-least
 5)    1           0.18     0.18    2.32%      0.18     0.18    2.32%  (anon) [/home/nick/.local/share/zsh-autosuggestions/zsh-autosuggestions.zsh:460]
 6)    1           0.11     0.11    1.48%      0.11     0.11    1.48%  (anon) [/home/nick/.local/share/fzf-tab/fzf-tab.zsh:398]
 7)    1           0.04     0.04    0.51%      0.04     0.04    0.51%  -fast-highlight-fill-option-variables
 8)    1           0.04     0.04    0.48%      0.04     0.04    0.48%  (anon) [/home/nick/.local/share/fast-syntax-highlighting/fast-highlight:35]
```

My end to end time is ~80ms:

```sh
$ time zsh -i -c exit
zsh -i -c exit  0.04s user 0.01s system 59% cpu 0.081 total
```

I'm not sure if zprof reports milliseconds but it's certainly adding more than 21ms of delay. The end to end time difference is +60ms (140 - 80). It's really noticeable because I have a feeling something else is causing even more of a delay that's not picked up in these tests. It feels like 200-300ms before the prompt is ready.

Any thoughts on how to troubleshoot what's causing this slowdown?
comments: @nickjj Indeed, it's much slower than running on my machine at the `zvm_exist_command`. You can try to research by disabling your other plugins one by one.

Hi, going by the raw speed between your machine and mine could be misleading due to machine specs.

I disabled all of the other plugins. It's still the same issue. The same relative percent slowness is there with only this plugin loaded.

If I have nothing but zvm enabled the end to end time is 120ms (with zvm) vs 70ms (without zvm) running `time zsh -i -c exit`.

Here's what happens with zprof when I only have this plugin loaded:

```sh
num  calls                time                       self            name
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1)    1          23.28    23.28  100.00%     23.28    23.28  100.00%  zvm_exist_command
```

It's about the same timing differences as my original report when the other 3 plugins are there too.

I'm able to reproduce this on Arch Linux and Ubuntu 24.04.
@nickjj Yes, it's roughly comparing by ignoring the machine specs. Could you run the following command `zvm_system_report | pbcopy` to copy straight to clipboard, then paste here?

Yep here you go. I am using the latest version of the Microsoft Terminal btw (it comes up as unknown):

```
- Terminal program: unknown unknown (xterm-256color)
- Operating system: Linux (5.15.167.4-microsoft-standard-WSL2 #1 SMP Tue Nov 5 00:21:55 UTC 2024 x86_64 GNU/Linux)
- ZSH framework: 
- ZSH version: zsh 5.9 (x86_64-pc-linux-gnu)
- ZVM version: zsh-vi-mode 0.11.0 
```

It's worth pointing out the issue happens with and without tmux as well.
just to confirm i don't have lagging issue after loading this plugin. don't feel any delay, no idea (don't have time to dig in).
I'm able to reproduce it on an M1 Mac, but it's less noticeable since that machine has a much faster CPU, but the benchmarks still show a delay introduced by this plugin.

> I'm able to reproduce it on an M1 Mac, but it's less noticeable since that machine has a much faster CPU, but the benchmarks still show a delay introduced by this plugin.

shell lag may depend on other sound like non-related issue like your system is chatty or io issue if even bare born zsh with just this plugin, but be aware some plugins in contrast speed up zsh a lot (like zsh-defer).

That's why I opened #304 .
Unfortunately, this PR has not received any response in the past half year.
Although I have abandoned `zsh-vi-mode`, I will still be happy if this PR can help others.

Interestingly, when I try that PR's patch I get `zvm_exist_command:1: bad floating point constant`.

Load times with `time zsh -i -c exit` went from 140ms (original) up to 210ms (PR patch) which is about 50% slower. zprof also shows more time spent on `zvm_exist_command`.

How did you benchmark your PR?

issueDTO.title: Convert Contributing to Mautic section to RST [multiple sub-issues]
issueDTO.description:
We are in the process of moving this repository to Read the Docs, and to do that we need to convert our pages from Markdown to RST. This issue is to transfer the Contribute to Mautic section: [https://contribute.mautic.org/contributing-to-mautic](https://contribute.mautic.org/contributing-to-mautic). You can also update and improve the content on these pages if you like - do check with the relevant team leads to ensure it's up to date and relevant.

## Sections to migrate 
As this is a large section I recommend that we take it one section at a time. Drop a message in the comments to be assigned to a section.

- [x] Designer
- [x] Developer
- [x] Marketer
- [x] Tester
- [x] Translator
- [x] Writing for Mautic
- [x] Event organiser
- [ ] Web developer
- [x] Server administrator
- [x] Contributing financially
- [x] Google Summer of Code @Iqmaa 

You can do this in the current repo, as we've got a folder set up, `/docs`, which will be used for Read The Docs.

You can build this documentation locally by cloning this repository, and following these steps: https://github.com/mautic/user-documentation/tree/5.x?tab=readme-ov-file#build-documentation-locally. Change into the /docs folder and then (assuming you have DDEV and Docker/Colima installed) type `ddev config` and select `build/html `as the root folder when configuring DDEV. Then when complete, type `ddev start` and it'll give you the link to your local testing environment.

If you need to make a link file to add an external URL, please use the command line tool 'make link'. This will generate a reference macro and a link file for you.

For internal linking check the docs on using the [:ref: role](https://docs.readthedocs.io/en/stable/guides/cross-referencing-with-sphinx.html#the-ref-role) for linking within the same document, and using [:doc: to link across pages](https://docs.readthedocs.io/en/stable/guides/cross-referencing-with-sphinx.html#the-doc-role).

**Please note: if you see folders called .revs these are old version control files from Grav. Ignore them! (they should be deleted) and instead work on the actual files.**

When you've converted the file/s, **they need to live within the /docs folder**. We can create a structure using sub-folders to organise the sections. You also need to add the pages to the Table of Contents in the index.rst file for them to show on the menu. Docs on the ToC can be found [here](https://sublime-and-sphinx-guide.readthedocs.io/en/latest/indices.html).

We highly recommend that you use VS Code with Vale installed. Let us know if you have any problems.

Some useful resources: 
- https://sublime-and-sphinx-guide.readthedocs.io/en/latest guide to Sphinx/RST formatting
- https://sublime-and-sphinx-guide.readthedocs.io/en/latest/references.html#use-the-external-links-extension how to do external links - always check the /docs/links directory first! You can use the terminal command '`make link`' to create the link file automagically.

There are many MD to RST tools out there which can help speed up the process, however you will still need to review your output to ensure it passes our Vale grammar rules. Headings must always be unique, as well.

We use the following for headings:

```
H1 ###
H2 ***
H3 ===
H4 ---
H5 ~~~
```

Please ask in #t-education on Slack if you get stuck with anything!
comments:
Hi @RCheesley,
I'd like to be assigned the 'google summer of code' section please.

Absolutely @Iqmaa please read the updated description above! Worth mentioning that we have the Assembly now on the community portal: https://community.mautic.org/assemblies/gsoc which is where we'll be taking ideas for projects, and also where our projects and updates from students are posted.

Hi @RCheesley,

I'm just aware of this issue. FYI, I've created a new issue (#265) to work on the Designer section and the corresponding PR (#266).

I'd like to take another section when everything goes well. 
Going forward, should I choose from the list here and inform you or create a new issue?

Thanks! 🙂
Thanks @adiati98 that's great - I think there's also now a feature of GitHub which allows us to create sub-issues so maybe we could do that @fakela @favour-chibueze ?

@RCheesley I was thinking to take the sub-issues based on the order.
That said, the next would be the Developers section (https://contribute.mautic.org/contributing-to-mautic/developer).

However, in this section, there are some other sections in the Table of Contents (TOC).
I believe all content in the TOC need to be converted as well to RST together with the Developer section?

If so, I might create a new issue to convert the Developer section with sub-issues to the TOC and create separate small PRs to avoid progress blocking.

Any thoughts?

I think that sounds sensible @adiati98 - especially for a section where there's so much content! We should also update the references to Gitpod because they are soon sunsetting their service, we are going to likely switch to GitHub's codespaces instead. We haven't documented it yet, though! 😅

> I think that sounds sensible [@adiati98](https://github.com/adiati98) - especially for a section where there's so much content! We should also update the references to Gitpod because they are soon sunsetting their service, we are going to likely switch to GitHub's codespaces instead. We haven't documented it yet, though! 😅

Oh, no... Working on the previous issue was my first experience with Gitpod, and it's sunsetting soon. 😅 
Would Gitpod be closed permanently or only for Mautic?

I normally prefer to work locally. However, it's somewhat challenging to follow the docs to set up things locally, especially on Windows. So, Gitpod is very helpful. I never use GitHub's codespaces, though.

But I think the pricing is worth to be noted, just in case many folks will use the service:

>  **How much does Codespaces cost?**
>
> Codespaces is free for individual use up to 60 hours a month and comes with simple, pay-as-you-go pricing after that. It???s also available for organizations with pay-as-you-go pricing and has pricing controls so any company or team can determine how much they want to spend a month. Learn more about Codespaces pricing for organizations [here](https://docs.github.com/billing/managing-billing-for-github-codespaces/about-billing-for-github-codespaces).

As far as I understand it, the free tier is being sunset for all. We will switch to codespaces instead come September. Indeed we should mention about the pricing for that, I think most people will be fine within their free tier.

issueDTO.title: TechDraw: Use the correct standard fonts (GOST Type A) for Russian locale drawing template (instead of Arial)
issueDTO.description:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [x] I have searched the existing issues

### Problem description

There are drawing templates for Russian locale in .svg format. They use Arial font. But according to GOST and Unified System for Design Documentation they should use GOST Type A font. I think the font for all the templates for Russian locale should be replaced.

### Full version info

```shell
OS: Windows 10 build 19045
Architecture: x86_64
Version: 1.0.0.39109 (Git) Conda
Build type: Release
Branch: (HEAD detached at 1.0.0)
Hash: 2fcc5317fe3aee96ca73475986a577719fc78e20
Python 3.11.10, Qt 5.15.15, Coin 4.0.3, Vtk 9.3.0, OCC 7.8.1
Locale: Russian/Kazakhstan (ru_KZ)
Stylesheet/Theme/QtStyle: FreeCAD Dark.qss/FreeCAD Dark/Fusion
```

### Subproject(s) affected?

TechDraw

### Anything else?

_No response_

### Code of Conduct

- [x] I agree to follow this project's Code of Conduct
comments: Any proposals on how to achieve this ?

@timursagdenov -- Luzpaz asked me to take a look here and I have some questions: - Do you have the GOST Type A font installed on your machine? - Do you know what license this font has? (To consider bundling it, I'd need to be public domain) - If the editable field had another option to let you choose a typeface: would that work?

In theory if GOST-A is commonly downloaded and on your machine, we should be able to update the font-family here:

https://github.com/FreeCAD/FreeCAD/blob/main/src/Mod/TechDraw/Templates/locale/ru/Leading_text/Portrait_A3.svg?short_path=68bec5e#L55-L78

To instead font-family:"GOST-A, Arial, San-Serif" and note in the docs if you want GOST TYPE A to make sure it's installed on your system. (In _theory_ -- lots of unknowns still)

issueDTO.title: Add a demo/playground mode for new users and workshop attendees
issueDTO.description:
**Description:**

This issue is to improve the onboarding experience for new users of llm4s, especially those who are:
-Completely new to the project
-Attended the talk "Let's Teach LLMs to Write Great Scala"

Many of them are interested in a demo to better understand what the library can do, and want a way to play around with it interactively.

Benefits:
- Faster onboarding for newcomers.
- Clear demonstration of llm4s features.
- Helpful companion for workshops and talks.
- Encourages experimentation and feedback.


**Current State:**

We already have basic tracing implemented, and it outputs trace info as text. This is useful for debugging or introspection but it???s not immediately clear to new users how to interact with it. There???s no obvious starting point for experimenting with the library.
Trace output isn???t highlighted or surfaced in a beginner-friendly way.

**Proposal:**

- Create a demo or playground mode that does the following:
- Let users input prompts (via CLI, web UI, or a simple REPL).
- Runs through an example llm4s pipeline.
- Clearly displays the tracing output, showing what the library is doing.
- Helps users understand how tracing works and what???s going on behind the scenes.
- Add visual formatting or even minimal UI for trace steps.
- Provide a few built-in example use cases to try.
- Integrate with documentation for a guided tour.
comments:
Hi @kannupriyakalra,
This is an excellent idea and perfectly aligns with showcasing the tracing system from PR #77. I'd like to work on this issue and have a comprehensive implementation plan.

**Phase 1: CLI Demo Showcase**
_Goal: Create an interactive CLI playground that demonstrates LLM4S capabilities with beautiful real-time tracing output._

Implementation:
1. Interactive CLI interface with scenario selection
2. Leverage existing PrintTracing from PR  #77 for colorful, formatted output
3. Pre-built demo scenarios (weather queries, reasoning tasks, code generation)
4. Step-by-step tracing explanation for beginners

**Phase 2: Web-Based UI Solutions**
_Goal: Create a web-based playground for broader accessibility and richer visualization._

Implementation:
1. Real-time web dashboard using existing WebSocket infrastructure
2. Interactive trace visualization showing agent execution flow
3. Embedded Langfuse integration for advanced users
4. Mobile-responsive design for accessibility

> Hi [@kannupriyakalra](https://github.com/kannupriyakalra), This is an excellent idea and perfectly aligns with showcasing the tracing system from PR [#77](https://github.com/llm4s/llm4s/pull/77). I'd like to work on this issue and have a comprehensive implementation plan.
> 
> **Phase 1: CLI Demo Showcase** _Goal: Create an interactive CLI playground that demonstrates LLM4S capabilities with beautiful real-time tracing output._
> 
> Implementation:
> 
> 1. Interactive CLI interface with scenario selection
> 2. Leverage existing PrintTracing from PR  [Basic text tracing implementation??#77](https://github.com/llm4s/llm4s/pull/77) for colorful, formatted output
> 3. Pre-built demo scenarios (weather queries, reasoning tasks, code generation)
> 4. Step-by-step tracing explanation for beginners
> 
> **Phase 2: Web-Based UI Solutions** _Goal: Create a web-based playground for broader accessibility and richer visualization._
> 
> Implementation:
> 
> 1. Real-time web dashboard using existing WebSocket infrastructure
> 2. Interactive trace visualization showing agent execution flow
> 3. Embedded Langfuse integration for advanced users
> 4. Mobile-responsive design for accessibility

Looks good to me, go for it :)

issueDTO.title: 📦 App Packaging 📦
issueDTO.description:
(Still incomplete) TODO list about packaging problems/features to be solved/implemented for the various operating systems.

<hr>

### Windows

- [ ] The installer doesn't remove previously installed instances of the app
- [ ] There is a command-line window opening and closing quickly at the end of the _Windows_ setup wizard since no other _WixToolset_ feature for running commands quietly worked as expected.
- [ ] The sample graphics used for the _Windows_ installer should be modified. Since transparency is supported, I suggest the dialog background be limited to the left side only to follow the standards and fix the visual issues there. The same can apply to the banner image, traditionally only an icon was shown on the right side of it.
- [ ] Sign the package

<hr>

### macOS

- [x] ~~Possibility to run cargo bundle without building again~~ (solved by manually building the .app file)
- [ ] The wrapper script to open the app on macOS should be changed (#197)
- [ ] Add Homebrew cask as per #309
- [ ] Sign the package

<hr>

### Linux

- [ ] AppImage, Flatpak, and other kinds of packages
- [ ] Build and publish a Debian Source Package
comments: Feel free to list other problems/features that come to your mind and I'll add them @4r7if3x
Could be worth getting an SSL certificate to sign the Windows package. Otherwise Windows Defender gets upset that it is an unknown publisher.

> Could be worth getting an SSL certificate to sign the Windows package. Otherwise Windows Defender gets upset that it is an unknown publisher.

Yep, absolutely. I immediately add it to the set of features.

I've been looking at packaging for Flatpak and AppImage for the last couple days.

While I can get it compiling into an installable and launchable Flatpak, I end up with the issue that it can't be granted the capabilities required. I looked at Wireshark's Flatpak to see if they worked around that, but it turns out they just patch it to say it can't be used to capture. 

AppImage has the same problem, I tried writing a wrapper script that grants the capabilities when the AppImage is run, but elevated commands (tried both sudo and pkexec to elevate) don't seem to have read or write access to the mount point in /tmp/ the AppImage files are in. It does however work if you elevate the entire AppImage.

Hey @AlleM43 thank you very much for spending some time on this.

I'm not familiar with such kind of packages so my first very basic question is whether they can be run as whole as sudo. 
In such case, we shouldn't have problems.

Anyway, under Linux Sniffnet usually doesn't need sudo but only special capabilities to inspect a network interface: 
> sudo setcap cap_net_raw,cap_net_admin=eip <your/Sniffnet/executable/path>


Could these capabilities be applied to the packages?

In any case, feel free to open a PR if you want.
I'd really like to include the build of such packages in the existing CI/CD packaging workflow.

The AppImage is able to be ran with sudo, and can capture if I do so. I've tried setting the capabilities, but applying them to the AppImage as a whole doesn't work because the AppImage runtime doesn't pass them onto the actual Sniffnet process. I also can't apply them at runtime, because setcap running as root has no access to the mountpoint where the binary is located.

Flatpak is much the same story, along with a level of filesystem isolation that precludes attempts at interactive elevation, and reportedly it specifically tells you to not run it with sudo.

I'm not overly familiar with Github Actions, but I'll take a look at it at some point tomorrow and see if I can cobble together CI for Flatpak and AppImage.
Thanks so much!
I just want to mention that in case the Flatpak isn't at all able to capture (even if run as sudo) then it doesn't make sense to package it.

A couple checks later, I'm fairly certain Flatpak isn't able to capture even as root because Flatpak's seccomp filter blocks the `AF_PACKET` address family used by libpcap to capture packets on Linux.

issueDTO.title: [Feat]: Decouple transport layer from the core logic, making it an interchangeable component.
issueDTO.description:
### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.

_No response_

### Describe the solution you'd like

This is attempted in #164 
That PR cannot be merged because it violates the https://a2aproject.github.io/A2A/v0.2.5/specification/#31-transport-protocol requirement "A2A communication MUST occur over HTTP(S)."
I like anyway the idea to have a pluggable transport layer.

### Describe alternatives you've considered

_No response_

### Additional context

_No response_

### Code of Conduct

- [x] I agree to follow this project's Code of Conduct
comments:
@maeste
I'm curious why communication is restricted to only HTTP(S). 
When the system becomes large, shouldn't the EDA architecture be the first choice? 
I have looked at many projects, and there hasn't been any attempt in this regard.

@Denovo1998, there are many reasons to use HTTP(S) + SSE in this case. Very briefly, a few points are
* A2A aims to be truly distributed across multiple locations over the internet. HTTP is the best protocol to avoid any problems with firewalls and NAT. Using proprietary protocols, especially binary ones, on non-standard ports introduces various challenges in this area 
HTTP is a well-known standard that is well-supported in all languages. A2A aims to be polyglot or even language-agnostic.
* EDA is great for many reasons, but it also has some negatives. The main one for A2A is it needs to rely on a message broker. A2A instead aims to be fully peer-to-peer protocol with discovery capabilities (like Kubernetes is for pods). IOW HTTP/SSE is more distributed in terms of control, but more tightly coupled in logic. EDA brokers are more centralized in transport, but more decoupled in system design.

Does it mean that an EDA architecture with similar concepts of agents and agent cards does not make sense? Not at all, I think it could make sense and can be an extension to apply on top of A2A-core to be used in a specific case based on local network communication (no firewall) and it may have some advantages. But it cannot be part of the SDK because it's out of the scope of the standard defined by the spec.
So, from here, my proposal: decouple the transport to make it easy to plug different transports to A2A-core. The SDK will use only HTTP/SSE and maybe gRPC in the future, but anyone can build his own local network A2A system over Pulsar, Kafka, MQTT etc. It may also be valuable to have a gateway between different protocols to expose an agent or a set of agents implemented in EDA as standard HTTP agents.

DOes it make sense and does it answer your question?

repository.name: a2a-java

summary.validationOrRequirement: A2A communication MUST occur over HTTP(S).
summary.attemptedFixes: The issue #164 was attempted, but it cannot be merged because it violates the A2A communication specification.
summary.otherNotes: The issue is about decoupling the transport layer from the core logic, making it an interchangeable component. The current implementation restricts communication to only HTTP(S) due to firewall and NAT issues. The author suggests decoupling the transport layer to make it easy to plug in different transports, such as HTTP/SSE, gRPC, Pulsar, Kafka, MQTT, etc.

issueDTO.title: There is a teeny tiny gap between the content and the border when we have a large radius
issueDTO.description:
## Repro
1. Set border radius to something large like 16
2. Set border thickness to something large like 10
3. Open a window, and note that there is a teeny tiny gap between the windows content and the border

## What's wrong here?
I am setting the radius of the border to the same thing as the radius of the content. However, this is wrong. The radius of the border _should_ be larger because that radius is being applied to a larger rectangle. Hence, we will need a larger radius there to make up for it. The solution won't be much code, but it is a bit of thinking to get the maths right. This is a good issue for anyone who likes geometry and signed distance fields :)

issueDTO.title: [BUG] Attributes with the same name can be created with different types
issueDTO.description:
When creating a user and group attribute, they can have different types. However, the LDAP spec requires each named attribute to have a single associated type.

**To Reproduce**
Create a "foo" attribute of type "string" for users.
Create a "foo" attribute of type "int" for groups.
Request the LDAP schema: the attribute will be listed twice with different names.

**Expected behavior**
Each attribute name should have a single associated type, across users and groups.

**Additional context**
https://ldap.com/attribute-types/

> An optional set of names that may be used to reference the attribute type as an alternative to the numeric OID. Each of these names must be unique across the set of all attribute types, although it is legal for an attribute type to have the same name as a different type of schema element (e.g., it is acceptable to have an attribute type and an object class that both have the same name).

**Proposed solution**
The LDAP schema generation should check for validity of attribute types across users and groups. In case of agreement, deduplicate. In case of conflict, return an error instead of generating the schema.

In addition, we should have a startup warning on conflicting attribute, and prevent users from creating them.
comments: @broeng @T0byV

repository.description: Light LDAP implementation
repository.name: lldap

summary.main: The issue is about creating attributes with the same name but different types for users and groups, which is against the LDAP spec, and the proposed solution is to check for validity and prevent conflicts.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The LDAP schema generation should check for validity of attribute types across users and groups, and prevent users from creating conflicting attributes.
summary.attemptedFixes: Proposed solution: The LDAP schema generation should check for validity of attribute types across users and groups, deduplicate in case of agreement, and return an error instead of generating the schema in case of conflict.
summary.otherNotes: The LDAP spec requires each named attribute to have a single associated type, and an optional set of names that may be used to reference the attribute type as an alternative to the numeric OID.

issueDTO.title: Change shortcut for moving a grid event to the sidebar
issueDTO.description: ### Feature Description As a user, I want the shortcut for moving events to the sidebar be consistent with the shortcuts for moving events between the sidebar, so that I don't have to memorize more shortcuts. In other words, the shortcut to move a timed event (grid or all-day) to the sidebar should be `CTRL + [META] + [LEFT/RIGHT ARROW]. ---- We currently have this working for the `[META] + SHIFT + ,` shortcut. Practically, in this issue we just need to change the shortcut to be `[META] + SHIFT + [LEFT ARROW]`. ### Use Case We're already using the `CTRL + [META]` prefix to move someday events - `CTRL + [META] + [RIGHT]` when a This Week event is open moves the event to the next week - `CTRL + [META] + [DOWN]` when a This Week event is open moves the event to the This Month section Keeping this same pattern for regular events feels intuitive. Users will hopefully internalize the idea that whenever they want to change an event's location, they just need to type `CTRL + [META]` and then play arrow with the arrows. ### Additional Context In the future, we're planning to experiment with allowing the users to reschedule events entirely with the keyboard. For example, they'd go from a sidebar event to the grid and then to the correct time without ever touching the mouse. Having a consistent shortcut experience is important for that workflow to work, so doing this now will pay dividends later.

issueDTO.title: Package manager support
issueDTO.description:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
Vcpkg or conan support help alleviate the setup for multiple libraries in a project. They help to get started quickly with a framework while still allowing other libraries to be added quickly.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
Rather than premade build setups, I think that having vcpkg or conan support would enable more ambitious discord bots to be created faster.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**

**Additional context**

*Tasks added by @braindigitalis*

- [x] vcpkg
- [x] xmake
- [x] AUR
- [x] SW Network
- [x] Libhunt
- [x] gentoo emerge/GURU
- [x] void linux XBPS
- [x] FreeBSD Ports/Packages
- [ ] apt, ppa
- [x] conan
- [x] brew
comments:
I added DPP to [xmake](https://xmake.io) repository (see https://github.com/xmake-io/xmake-repo/pull/1222), with my changes it compiles fine on Windows, MinGW, Linux, macOS in both dynamic and static linking.

Since xmake is able to handle dependencies (will find libraries on the machine like cmake but is able to download and compile them if it doesn't find them), I managed to build the lib using a [very short xmake.lua](https://github.com/xmake-io/xmake-repo/pull/1222/files#diff-2ed89fc4a92b58abab98e8f69d6b0a570317c36ce43ab1bf391921513dbbe43c).

Usually, xmake packages use CMake to build CMake libraries, but the way dependencies are handled on DPP doesn't help much (mostly because they are embedded). Which is why I patched nlohmann/fmt out of the lib.

I also fixed the export.h header which made static linking impossible on Windows, here's the diff:
```patch
diff --git a/include/dpp/export.h b/include/dpp/export.h
index b7b35b5..838f79d 100644
--- a/include/dpp/export.h
+++ b/include/dpp/export.h
@@ -24,25 +24,29 @@
 // Investigate: MSVC doesn't like this
 //static_assert(__cplusplus >= 201703L, "D++ Requires a C++17 compatible compiler. Please ensure that you have enabled C++17 in your compiler flags.");
 
-#ifdef DPP_BUILD
+#ifndef DPP_STATIC
 
-	#ifdef _WIN32
-		#include <dpp/win32_safe_warnings.h>
-	#endif
+	#ifdef DPP_BUILD
+
+		#ifdef _WIN32
+			#include <dpp/win32_safe_warnings.h>
+		#endif
 
-	#ifdef _WIN32
-		#define DPP_EXPORT __declspec(dllexport)
+		#ifdef _WIN32
+			#define DPP_EXPORT __declspec(dllexport)
+		#else
+			#define DPP_EXPORT
+		#endif
 	#else
-		#define DPP_EXPORT
+		#ifdef _WIN32
+			#define DPP_EXPORT __declspec(dllimport)
+		#else
+			#define DPP_EXPORT
+		#endif
 	#endif
+
 #else
-	#ifdef _WIN32
-		#define DPP_EXPORT __declspec(dllimport)
-		/* This is required otherwise fmt::format requires additional file linkage to your project */
-		#define FMT_HEADER_ONLY
-	#else
-		#define DPP_EXPORT
-	#endif
+	#define DPP_EXPORT
 #endif
 
 #ifndef _WIN32
```
nlohmann and fmt are header only. it would be nicer if they weren't patched out, because we test with specific versions and not just whatever the latest is which could cause support issues

xmake can be instructed to use a specific version of nlohmann/fmt.
The main issue here is that by embedding a specific version of those libraries (and not putting them in a namespace), you conflict with the user nlohmann/fmt libs (obligating them to use the very same version you're using for API/ABI compatibility).

Since these libraries are very well tested, I think it would be better to not embed them to prevent such issues.

> I added DPP to [xmake](https://xmake.io) repository (see [xmake-io/xmake-repo#1222](https://github.com/xmake-io/xmake-repo/pull/1222)), with my changes it compiles fine on Windows, MinGW, Linux, macOS in both dynamic and static linking.
> 
> Since xmake is able to handle dependencies (will find libraries on the machine like cmake but is able to download and compile them if it doesn't find them), I managed to build the lib using a [very short xmake.lua](https://github.com/xmake-io/xmake-repo/pull/1222/files#diff-2ed89fc4a92b58abab98e8f69d6b0a570317c36ce43ab1bf391921513dbbe43c).
> 
> Usually, xmake packages use CMake to build CMake libraries, but the way dependencies are handled on DPP doesn't help much (mostly because they are embedded). Which is why I patched nlohmann/fmt out of the lib.
> 
> I also fixed the export.h header which made static linking impossible on Windows, here's the diff:
> 
> ```diff
> diff --git a/include/dpp/export.h b/include/dpp/export.h
> index b7b35b5..838f79d 100644
> --- a/include/dpp/export.h
> +++ b/include/dpp/export.h
> @@ -24,25 +24,29 @@
>  // Investigate: MSVC doesn't like this
>  //static_assert(__cplusplus >= 201703L, "D++ Requires a C++17 compatible compiler. Please ensure that you have enabled C++17 in your compiler flags.");
>  
> -#ifdef DPP_BUILD
> +#ifndef DPP_STATIC
>  
> -	#ifdef _WIN32
> -		#include <dpp/win32_safe_warnings.h>
> -	#endif
> +	#ifdef DPP_BUILD
> +
> +		#ifdef _WIN32
> +			#include <dpp/win32_safe_warnings.h>
> +		#endif
>  
> -	#ifdef _WIN32
> -		#define DPP_EXPORT __declspec(dllexport)
> +		#ifdef _WIN32
> +			#define DPP_EXPORT __declspec(dllexport)
> +		#else
> +			#define DPP_EXPORT
> +		#endif
>  	#else
> -		#define DPP_EXPORT
> +		#ifdef _WIN32
> +			#define DPP_EXPORT __declspec(dllimport)
> +		#else
> +			#define DPP_EXPORT
> +		#endif
>  	#endif
> +
>  #else
> -	#ifdef _WIN32
> -		#define DPP_EXPORT __declspec(dllimport)
> -		/* This is required otherwise fmt::format requires additional file linkage to your project */
> -		#define FMT_HEADER_ONLY
> -	#else
> -		#define DPP_EXPORT
> -	#endif
> +	#define DPP_EXPORT
>  #endif
>  
>  #ifndef _WIN32
> ```

with this diff applied does dpp still build ok outside of xmake?
the FMT_HEADER_ONLY was there for a reason and otherwise it would build but fail at runtime...

> with this diff applied does dpp still build ok outside of xmake?

Yes, but DPP_STATIC should be handled in the cmakelists.

> the FMT_HEADER_ONLY was there for a reason and otherwise it would build but fail at runtime...

It makes little sense to build the lib without FMT_HEADER_ONLY and use it with user code, the reason it was failing was because `fmt` has to be linked to the final executable without that flag, something a proper package manager guarantees.

> xmake can be instructed to use a specific version of nlohmann/fmt. The main issue here is that by embedding a specific version of those libraries (and not putting them in a namespace), you conflict with the user nlohmann/fmt libs (obligating them to use the very same version you're using for API/ABI compatibility).
> 
> Since these libraries are very well tested, I think it would be better to not embed them to prevent such issues.

I see, I will consider moving dpp's copies to a namespace to prevent conflicts.

> > with this diff applied does dpp still build ok outside of xmake?
> 
> Yes, but DPP_STATIC should be handled in the cmakelists.
> 
> > the FMT_HEADER_ONLY was there for a reason and otherwise it would build but fail at runtime...
> 
> It makes little sense to build the lib without FMT_HEADER_ONLY and use it with user code, the reason it was failing was because `fmt` has to be linked to the final executable without that flag, something a proper package manager guarantees.

thanks! can you please submit a pr of this diff against dev branch and I'll merge it in...

> I see, I will consider moving dpp's copies to a namespace to prevent conflicts.

Unfortunately this won't be enough, because of preprocessor defines (libs header guards), there's no proper way to embed fmt/nlohmann in a project headers.

> thanks! can you please submit a pr of this diff against dev branch and I'll merge it in...

Someone else is working on this already, all my changes will only be applied when installing dpp through xmake.

issueDTO.title: [Bugs] OAuth2 Authentication Fails with OpenBao (Vault) Generated Certificates
issueDTO.description:
## Describe the bug
Free5GC OAuth2 authentication fails when using certificates generated by OpenBao (HashiCorp Vault fork) PKI engine, but works correctly with the pre-generated certificates included in the repository.

## To Reproduce
Steps to reproduce the behavior:

1. Generate certificate using OpenBao PKI with standard enterprise settings
2. Configure NRF and other NFs to use the OpenBao-generated certificate
3. Attempt OAuth2 authentication between network functions
4. Observe `crypto/rsa: verification error` in logs

Sample files that were used for creating the openbao, issuer and certs can be found in:

[certificate-generation-files.zip](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/21008291/certificate-generation-files.zip)

## Expected behavior
OAuth2 authentication should work with certificates generated by standard PKI engines like OpenBao/Vault, similar to how it works with the pre-generated certificates.

## Environment (please complete the following information):
 - free5GC Version: v4.0.1
 - OS: Ubuntu 22.04.5 LTS
 - Kernel version: 5.15.0-142-generic
 - go version: I am using the free5gc provide container images, they don't have the go binary installed

## Trace File
### Configuration File

Sample NRF config:
```

2025-07-06T17:32:35.713197695Z [ERRO][NRF][Main] NRF Run Error: NRF init: gen cert file create: open ./cert/nrf.pem: read-only file system
```

So I don't think pre-generated certs will work? 

Also is it compulsory to use cert naming convention like nrf.pem, nrf.key. ausf.pem,ausf.key etc?

I think I understand now

- NRF will only use the cert/nrf.pem and nrf.key path. I don't think this is best practice, cert path should be flexible
- NRF will always generate new nrf.pem and nrf.key. While this works, it breaks the concept of TLS if TLS certificate generation is outside of Free5gc
- With the above I don't think the TLS implementation is solid currently and it seems that mTLS is not currently implemented.

To move on with my tests, I allowed NRF to generate it's cert with all of warnings in the logs but it does work

repository.description: Open source 5G core network based on 3GPP R15
repository.name: free5gc

summary.main: OAuth2 authentication fails with certificates generated by OpenBao (HashiCorp Vault fork) PKI engine, but works correctly with the pre-generated certificates included in the repository.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The certificates generated by OpenBao (HashiCorp Vault fork) PKI engine should be used for OAuth2 authentication, but the NRF will only use the cert/nrf.pem and nrf.key path. The certificate verification fails due to the certificate signed by unknown authority.
summary.attemptedFixes: NRF will generate its own cert, but it will always generate new nrf.pem and nrf.key. This is not flexible and breaks the concept of TLS. The certificate verification fails due to the certificate signed by unknown authority.
summary.otherNotes: OAuth2 authentication fails with certificates generated by OpenBao (HashiCorp Vault fork) PKI engine, but works correctly with the pre-generated certificates included in the repository. The issue is related to the certificate verification. NRF will only use the cert/nrf.pem and nrf.key path. NRF will always generate new nrf.pem and nrf.key. With the above, it seems that mTLS is not currently implemented. The TLS implementation is not solid currently.

issueDTO.title: Resolve Vertex Scheduler Character Limit Issue for Long Pipeline Names
issueDTO.description:
## Open Source Contributors Welcomed!
Please comment below if you would like to work on this issue!

### Contact Details [Optional]

support@zenml.io

## What happened?
A user encountered an issue where the Vertex scheduler in ZenML does not accept pipeline names longer than 64 characters. This limitation requires users to shorten their pipeline names to successfully schedule their pipelines on Vertex AI, which can be restrictive and inconvenient.

## Task Description
Investigate and address the issue with the Vertex scheduler's character limit for pipeline names in ZenML. The goal is to either increase the character limit or implement a mechanism that automatically handles longer names without user intervention.

## Expected Outcome
Users should be able to schedule pipelines on Vertex AI without the constraint of a 64-character limit on pipeline names.
ZenML should provide a seamless experience, either by accommodating longer names or by intelligently managing them within the existing Vertex scheduler limitations.
This fix will enhance user convenience and flexibility in naming pipelines.

## Steps to Implement
- Reproduce the issue to understand the exact limitations and behavior of the Vertex scheduler with respect to pipeline names.
- Explore solutions such as increasing the character limit or automatically abbreviating/transforming long pipeline names while preserving their uniqueness and recognizability.
- Implement the chosen solution in a way that is transparent and intuitive for the user.
- Test the implementation with various pipeline name lengths to ensure compatibility and functionality.
- Update documentation to inform users about the handling of pipeline names in Vertex scheduler and any best practices or limitations.

## Additional Context
This issue is crucial for users who require descriptive and potentially lengthy names for their pipelines, especially in complex or large-scale MLOps environments.

## Code of Conduct
- [ ] I agree to follow this project's Code of Conduct
comments: @christianversloot if I'm not completely mistaken, we had a conversation about this in Slack? Unfortunately the slack history hasn't been retained.
Correct, but that was for SageMaker orchestrator. There, I believe we limit name length to circumvent this error. It could perhaps be inspiration for a fix here :)
@christianversloot ah yes! https://github.com/zenml-io/zenml/pull/1505 was the PR.

@strickvl @christianversloot 
I would like to work on this... Please assign!
has the bug been solved? if not i would like to solve it
The bug has not been solved yet @Merthoshan. @ashutosh887 are you working on it, if not, can let @Merthoshan take a shot.

Where can we discuss if we're facing some issues understanding the bug? @strickvl 
I've worked it
Here is the place.
is there a simpler way to replicate this I could take this but It's going to be difficult for me to replicate this if this needs me to setup GCP which requires some cost. @strickvl

Hi! I???d like to work on this issue. My plan is to explore where the pipeline name is constructed and add a fix that truncates or sanitizes names to comply with Vertex???s 64-character limit. Could you please assign this to me? Thanks! @strickvl

issueDTO.title: Persist data in default directory
issueDTO.description: Use `directories` crate to persist `config.toml` and potentially the DB for #63 in a standard location. Handle situation where more than one app is run
comments: You mean `dirs`? I think this should be optional and consumers should be able to plug their own db.

I meant [directories](https://crates.io/crates/directories) based on [bitmask's config setup](https://github.com/diba-io/carbonado-node/blob/main/src/config.rs) suggestion from @cryptoquick.

twas past my bedtime when I drafted the atrocity of the original issue text

Ah, OK, `dirs` is almost the same and should be sufficient but I may be missing something. But thinking about it more this makes less and less sense.

* Needs to have a unique name to not collide with other stuff
* What if the consumer already uses a db? This would add another dependency.
* Needs to also accept project name
* Might need to create the directory but so may the rest of the application and perhaps it will want to set some permissions or detect first-run situation.
* Generally feels out-of scope

I think two things are being conflated

1. the topic of this issue data persistence / configuration folder for `payjoin-cli`. This could go in a .payjoin folder at the default app location. Right now the config file is called from wherever the binary is invoked. An alternative could be to pass config path via cli.
2. A receiver saving inputs that have been seen. Right now this is done KISS by serializing a `HashSet` to a file called `inputs_seen.json` again, wherever the binary is invoked. Uri already uses `serde`, and I don't see that dependency as additional or going anywhere anytime soon.

Having a proper DB would definitely be better, but I don't want to overoptimize before user demand. In the worst case we could migrate the HashSet to a more robust / performant DB later. This issue is separate to the one of keeping data organized in a payjoin-cli specific data folder

Ah, this is about cli, not library, it makes sense then. Originally CLI was intended as PoC but it could be nice to develop it further. In that case I totally agree it should be stored in a DB. I have experience with `rusqlite` which works fine but has a bit annoying MSRV.
This was closed by https://github.com/payjoin/rust-payjoin/pull/281/files which added a proper DB and the option to set a custom DB path as an option.

My concern with this issue is when people `cargo install payjoin-cli` the behavior changes depending on which directory they call the program in. Using a default directory and only using an alternative with a manual configuration argument would fix this problem
working on this  ,  is this still something we need ?

This is definitely on the periphery of our essential path. It's non-essential (cause what we have does already work) but nice to have. The point is so that `cargo install payjoin-cli` can have a standard location for config & persisted data which you might want if you uninstalled/re-installed or to make documentation easier to read.

I have not thought through all of the trade-offs nor through a user experience that would enable multiple configs on the same machine. Right now I often use one config in the top level payjoin and another in the payjoin-cli subdirectory to test payjoin-cli end to end.


For these reasons I suggest you take it on only if you're confident you can make good decisions about trade offs and come up with a comprehensive solution somewhat independently, and if you find it essential to your personal goals.

The author is working on using a default directory and only using an alternative with a manual configuration argument to fix the problem.

It's considered non-essential but nice to have, especially for users who want a standard location for config & persisted data after uninstalling/re-installing or for easier documentation.
