issueDTO.title: Feature: Onboarding Wizard for New Users
issueDTO.description:
## Summary

Implement a comprehensive onboarding wizard that guides new BirdNET-Go users through initial setup, educates them about AI limitations, and provides an interactive tour of the web interface. This will significantly improve the first-time user experience and reduce configuration errors.

**📝 Note: This feature proposal is open for comments and feedback from the community. Please share your thoughts on the design, suggest improvements, or indicate which aspects would be most valuable to you.**

## Background

New users currently need to manually configure BirdNET-Go through YAML files or the web interface without guided assistance. This can be overwhelming and may lead to suboptimal configurations or missed features. An onboarding wizard would:

- Guide users through essential configuration steps
- Educate about AI model limitations and appropriate use cases
- Showcase key features through an interactive tour
- Provide option to import existing BirdNET-Pi data
- Ensure users understand privacy implications and data sharing options

## Proposed Solution

### 1. Welcome Screen

On first launch, display a modal dialog with:

```
Welcome to BirdNET-Go!

BirdNET-Go is powered by the BirdNET Analyzer AI model developed by
the BirdNET Team at Cornell Lab of Ornithology and Chemnitz University
of Technology. Learn more at github.com/birdnet-team/BirdNET-Analyzer

Ready to set up your bird monitoring station?

[Get Started] [Import from BirdNET-Pi]
```

### 2. Setup Wizard (6 Steps)

#### Step 1: Location Configuration
- Interactive map widget for setting latitude/longitude
- Auto-detect location option (with permission)
- Display: "Your location helps filter species to those likely in your area"
- Show preview of common species for the selected location

#### Step 2: Audio Source
- Radio buttons for audio source selection:
  - 🎤 Microphone/Soundcard (default)
  - 📹 RTSP Stream
  - 🔊 Multiple Sources
- Audio level meter showing real-time input
- "Test Audio" button with visual feedback
- Troubleshooting link if no audio detected

#### Step 3: Language & Display
- Dropdown with 40+ language options for species names
- Time format toggle (12/24 hour)
- Timezone selection (auto-detect with override option)
- Preview of species name in selected language

#### Step 4: Detection Settings
- Preset selection with descriptions:
  ```
  ?????? Balanced (Recommended)
  Good balance of accuracy and sensitivity
  ??? Confidence threshold: 0.8
  ??? Sensitivity: 1.0
  
  🎯 High Accuracy
  Fewer false positives, may miss some birds
  ??? Confidence threshold: 0.9
  ??? Deep Detection enabled
  
  📡 High Sensitivity  
  Detects more birds, more false positives
  ??? Confidence threshold: 0.6
  ??? Sensitivity: 1.25
  ```
- "Show Advanced Settings" expandable section

#### Step 5: Privacy & Integration
- Privacy options:
  - [ ] Enable privacy filter (removes detections when human voices detected)
  - [ ] Enable dog bark filter (reduces false owl/crow detections)
- Data sharing:
  - [ ] Share detections with BirdWeather community
  - [ ] Enable anonymous telemetry to help improve BirdNET-Go
- Audio retention:
  - Export audio clips: [Yes/No]
  - Retention policy: [7 days / 30 days / Forever]

### 3. Interactive Web UI Tour

Using a JavaScript tour library (e.g., Shepherd.js), create guided tour with these stops:

1. **Dashboard Overview**
   ```
   Spotlight: Main dashboard area
   "This is your command center. Recent detections appear here
   in real-time. The summary shows your most detected species."
   ```

2. **Detection Details**
   ```
   Spotlight: Detection row
   "Click any detection to see the spectrogram, listen to audio,
   and verify or correct the identification."
   ```

3. **Live Audio Stream**
   ```
   Spotlight: Audio level indicator
   "Click here to listen to your live audio feed and check
   microphone placement."
   ```

4. **Settings Access**
   ```
   Spotlight: Settings menu
   "Fine-tune detection parameters, manage species lists,
   and configure integrations here."
   ```

5. **Species Management**
   ```
   Spotlight: Species settings
   "Add species to always include or exclude, and set
   custom thresholds for specific birds."
   ```

### 4. BirdNET-Pi Import

If user selects import option:

```
Import from BirdNET-Pi

1. Upload your BirdNET-Pi database:
   [Choose File] (Accepts: birds.db, *.sqlite)

2. Import options:
   [???] Historical detections
   [???] Species include/exclude lists
   [???] Custom species settings
   [ ] Audio recordings (if available)

3. Date range:
   From: [Date picker] To: [Date picker]

[Import] [Skip]

Progress: [??????????????????????????????] 80% - Importing detections...
```

### 5. Completion Screen

```
??? Setup Complete!

BirdNET-Go is now monitoring for bird sounds.

Quick tips:
??? First detections may take 15-30 seconds to appear
??? Check Settings ??? Range Filter to see species expected in your area
??? Enable notifications for rare bird alerts
??? Join our community forum for tips and support

[View Dashboard] [Documentation] [Run Tour Again]
```

### 6. Responsible Use Guidelines (Final Step)

After setup completion, display this important information:

```
🦜 Using BirdNET-Go Responsibly

BirdNET-Go is a powerful tool that enhances your birding experience through
AI-assisted identification. To ensure the best outcomes for both birding 
and conservation:

??? Review and verify detections before sharing observations
??? Use the confidence scores as a guide, not absolute truth
??? Cross-reference with field guides and local expertise
??? Consider seasonal patterns and habitat suitability

When contributing to citizen science:
??? Only submit observations you've personally verified
??? Include notes about visual or behavioral confirmation
??? Use AI detections as a starting point for your own observations

This approach ensures data quality for scientific research while maximizing
your learning and enjoyment of birds!

[???] I understand

[Start Monitoring]
```

## Implementation Tasks

- [ ] Create wizard component structure in web UI
- [ ] Implement state management for wizard progress
- [ ] Add API endpoint: `GET /api/v2/wizard/status`
- [ ] Add API endpoint: `POST /api/v2/wizard/complete`
- [ ] Create location picker component with map
- [ ] Implement audio source selector with level meter
- [ ] Build preset configuration templates
- [ ] Integrate JavaScript tour library
- [ ] Create tour content and styling
- [ ] Implement BirdNET-Pi import functionality
- [ ] Add database migrations for import
- [ ] Create user preference storage for wizard completion
- [ ] Add "Reset Wizard" option in settings
- [ ] Implement skip/back navigation
- [ ] Add help tooltips and contextual information
- [ ] Create responsive mobile layout
- [ ] Write user documentation
- [ ] Add integration tests

## UI/UX Considerations

- Use consistent styling with existing BirdNET-Go interface
- Ensure accessibility (ARIA labels, keyboard navigation)
- Provide clear progress indication (step 1 of 6)
- Allow users to go back and modify previous choices
- Save progress in case of interruption
- Offer "Quick Setup" vs "Custom Setup" paths
- Include contextual help and tooltips
- Support for mobile and tablet layouts

## Technical Requirements

- Frontend: Leverage existing Alpine.js/HTMX stack
- Use Tailwind CSS for consistent styling  
- Store wizard completion state in user preferences
- Graceful fallback if JavaScript disabled
- Compatible with all authentication methods
- Internationalization support for wizard text

## Success Metrics

- Reduction in support requests about initial configuration

- Community-contributed location-specific tips

Please share your thoughts in the comments below!

issueDTO.title: Feature: eBird Export for Verified Detections
issueDTO.description:
# Feature: eBird Export for Verified Detections

## Summary

Implement an eBird-compatible CSV export feature that allows users to export their verified bird detections from BirdNET-Go in a format suitable for direct upload to eBird.org. This will enable citizen scientists to contribute their acoustic monitoring data to eBird's global bird observation database.

## Background

BirdNET-Go users accumulate valuable bird detection data that could contribute to citizen science efforts through eBird. Currently, there's no easy way to export this data in eBird's required format. Users must manually transcribe their detections, which is time-consuming and error-prone.

eBird is the world's largest biodiversity-related citizen science project, and enabling easy data export would:
- Allow BirdNET-Go users to contribute to global bird monitoring efforts
- Provide validation of acoustic detections through eBird's review process
- Enable users to maintain their eBird life lists with acoustic observations
- Support scientific research by making acoustic monitoring data more accessible

## Requirements

### eBird CSV Format Requirements (from eBird documentation)

**File specifications:**
- CSV format with comma delimiters
- Maximum file size: 1 MB
- No quotation marks in data
- No hard returns/line breaks

**Required columns:**
1. **Date** - MM/DD/YYYY format
2. **Country** - 2-character ISO code
3. **State/Province** - 1-3 character code
4. **Location Name** - Text description
5. **Protocol** - e.g., "Stationary", "Traveling"
6. **Start Time** - Military or 12-hour format
7. **Duration** - In minutes
8. **All observations reported** - Y/N
9. **Species Name** - Common or Scientific (must match eBird taxonomy)
10. **Species Count** - Number, X (presence), + (continuing count), or * (uncounted)

**Additional requirements:**
- Single location per checklist
- Single calendar date per checklist
- Species names must match current eBird taxonomy
- Optional latitude/longitude in decimal degrees

## Proposed Solution

### 1. API Endpoint

Create a new API v2 endpoint for data export:

```
GET /api/v2/export/ebird
```

**Query parameters:**
- `date_start` - Start date (YYYY-MM-DD)
- `date_end` - End date (YYYY-MM-DD)  
- `verified_only` - Boolean, export only user-verified detections (default: true)
- `format` - Export format, initially "ebird" (extensible for future formats)

**Response:**
- Content-Type: text/csv
- Content-Disposition: attachment; filename="birdnet-go-ebird-export-YYYY-MM-DD.csv"

### 2. Data Processing

**Grouping Strategy:**
- Group verified detections by date to create daily "checklists"
- Use earliest detection time as checklist start time
- Calculate duration from first to last detection of the day
- Default to "Stationary" protocol with user-configurable override

**Data Mapping:**
- Map BirdNET common names to eBird taxonomy
- Handle special cases (e.g., "Rock Pigeon" ??? "Rock Pigeon (Feral Pigeon)")
- Use "X" for species count (presence-only data)
- Set "All observations reported" to "N" (acoustic monitoring may miss species)

### 3. Configuration

Add export settings to config.yaml:

```yaml
export:
  ebird:
    country_code: "US"        # Default country code
    state_code: "CA"          # Default state/province code  
    location_name: "My Yard"  # Default location name
    protocol: "Stationary"    # Default protocol
    default_duration: 60      # Default duration if only one detection
```

### 4. User Interface

**Export Page** (`/export`):
- Date range picker with presets (Today, This Week, This Month, Custom)
- Checkbox: "Export verified detections only" (checked by default)
- Export format dropdown (initially just "eBird CSV")
- Preview table showing what will be exported
- Download button
- Help text explaining eBird requirements

**Access:**
- Add "Export Data" menu item under Tools section in sidebar
- Require authentication to access export features

### 5. Implementation Details

#### File Structure:
```
internal/
  api/v2/
    export.go         # API endpoint handlers
  export/
    ebird.go          # eBird format conversion logic
    ebird_test.go     # Unit tests
  datastore/
    export_queries.go # Database queries for export
```

#### Key Functions:

```go
// API Handler
func (c *Controller) ExportEBird(ctx echo.Context) error

// Export Logic  
func GenerateEBirdCSV(detections []datastore.Note, settings ExportSettings) ([]byte, error)

// Data Access
func (ds *DataStore) GetVerifiedDetectionsForExport(startDate, endDate string) ([]Note, error)
```

## Technical Considerations

### Performance
- Implement pagination for large date ranges
- Add caching for species name mappings
- Stream CSV generation for memory efficiency

### Data Quality
- Only export user-verified detections by default
- Validate species names against eBird taxonomy
- Handle timezone conversions correctly

### Security
- Require authentication for export endpoint
- Validate date ranges to prevent excessive exports
- Implement rate limiting (e.g., 10 exports per hour)
- Sanitize location names and other text fields

### Error Handling
- Clear error messages for invalid date ranges
- Warn if no verified detections found
- Handle eBird taxonomy mismatches gracefully

## Future Enhancements

1. **Direct eBird API Upload**
   - Integrate with eBird API for direct checklist submission
   - Store eBird API tokens securely
   - Show upload status and eBird checklist links

2. **Additional Export Formats**
   - Generic CSV with all detection data
   - JSON export for programmatic use
   - KML for mapping applications

3. **Advanced Features**
   - Scheduled automatic exports
   - Email export results
   - Batch operations for multiple date ranges
   - Custom checklist grouping (by hour, location, etc.)

4. **Species Mapping Management**
   - Admin interface for taxonomy mapping
   - Automatic taxonomy updates from eBird
   - Handle subspecies and regional variations

## Success Metrics

- Number of users utilizing export feature
- Volume of detections exported to eBird
- User feedback on ease of use
- Successful eBird upload rate
- Reduction in manual data entry time

## Testing Plan

1. **Unit Tests**
   - CSV format generation
   - Date/time formatting
   - Species name mapping
   - Edge cases (empty data, single detection, etc.)

2. **Integration Tests**
   - API endpoint with various parameters
   - Database query performance
   - Authentication and authorization

3. **Manual Testing**
   - Export and upload to eBird sandbox
   - Verify all required fields present
   - Test with various date ranges and data volumes

## Documentation

- User guide for export feature
- eBird upload walkthrough
- Troubleshooting common issues
- API documentation for developers

## References

- [eBird Upload Spreadsheet Data](https://support.ebird.org/en/support/solutions/articles/48000907878-upload-spreadsheet-data-to-ebird)
- [eBird API Documentation](https://documenter.getpostman.com/view/664302/S1ENwy59)
- Current BirdNET-Go CSV export: `internal/observation/observation.go`

## Request for Feedback

This feature would bridge BirdNET-Go with the global eBird community. Please share your thoughts:

- Would you use this feature to contribute to eBird?
- What additional export formats would be valuable?
- Any concerns about data quality or privacy?
- Suggestions for the user interface?

Your input will help shape this feature to best serve the BirdNET-Go community!

issueDTO.title: `spice configure dataset` allows specifying an invalid dataset name
issueDTO.description:
## Describe the bug

_A clear and concise description of what the bug is._

When using `spice configure dataset`, the prompts allow specifying a dataset name that is invalid. For example, `taxi-trips` can be input as the dataset name and the dataset is configured "successfully" - but the Runtime will fail to start with this dataset, because a dataset name with a hyphen is not permitted.

## To Reproduce

_Steps to reproduce the behavior:_

1. Use `spice configure dataset` to configure a dataset with an invalid name
2. See Runtime startup error

## Expected behavior

_A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen._

`spice configure dataset` should not allow specifying an invalid dataset name.

issueDTO.title: Add Title-Based Auto-Linking for PDF Files
issueDTO.description: ### ??? Problem JabRef currently supports three auto-linking strategies to associate files with entries: * **Starts with citation key** * **Exact match with citation key** * **Custom regular expression** However, these strategies fall short when the file name does **not** include the citation key. Many users name files based on the **title**, making it impossible to auto-link them with the current strategies. ### ??? Goal Implement a new **title-based fuzzy matching** strategy for auto-linking files to entries. This will improve usability for users who name their files using (parts of) the publication title. --- ### 🧩 Tasks 1. **Create a new `TitleBasedFileFinder` class** * Package: `org.jabref.logic.util.io` * Use the title field of the BibEntry for matching 2. **Implement a robust matching strategy** * Convert LaTeX title to Unicode: `LatexToUnicodeAdapter#format` * Clean invalid characters: `FileNameCleaner#cleanFileName` * Match using: * **Substring** * Optional: **Jaro-Winkler similarity** with a threshold (e.g., 0.05) 3. **Write unit tests** * Focus on edge cases, Unicode, cleaned filenames, and fuzzy similarity 4. **Integrate into preferences** * Update `AutoLinkPreferences` * Modify `FileFinders#constructFromConfiguration` * Extend the Preferences UI to support selecting this new strategy --- ### 🧪 Why This Is a Good First Issue * Introduces you to **test-driven development** * Touches core parts of JabRef: logic layer, UI, and preferences * Requires critical thinking ??? not solvable by AI, but rewarding to implement * You???ll learn about string similarity, file I/O, and JabRef???s data model --- ### 📚 Related Work * Feature request: #9267 * Prior art: PR #9316 --- Interested? Start by checking how `org.jabref.logic.util.io.CitationKeyBasedFileFinder` works and mimic the structure. Then expand and adapt for titles! Let us know if you need any help to get started 🚀

issueDTO.title: Demonstrate proper use of aria-label and title attributes for icon buttons
issueDTO.description:
### Link to the Page

https://www.skeleton.dev/docs/tailwind/buttons

### Describe the Issue (screenshots encouraged!)

Currently we showcase icons buttons as a button element wrapping an icon. But we should also encourage best practices when it comes to a11y and include an `aria-label` field for these that describes the purpose of the button to end users. This can come in the form of a `aria-label` and `title` attributes:

### What to Change

Before:

```html
<button type="button" class="btn-icon preset-filled"><IconArrowRight size={18} /></button>
```

After:

```html
<button type="button" class="btn-icon preset-filled" title="Go" aria-label="Go">
    <IconArrowRight size={18} />
</button>
```

Additionally we should scan all portions of our applications (docs + theme generator) for instances of `btn-icon` and append these attributes accordingly, so we're practicing what we preach.

---

> NOTE: there *may* be icon buttons used within components, in that case we'll need to add new props to said components to allow for proper i18n translations. These should be documented in a new/standalone issue as a separate follow up task. This will be out of scope of this ticket.
comments: Hi, I'd like to start contributing and this would be my first open-source PR. Can I please work on this issue?

That would be great @JamesN-dev just take note that we should track any component this affects, but not modify them...yet. I'd like to take stock before we modify component props. I'll assign the ticket now.

Thanks @endigo9740 !

I did a full sweep for btn-icon usage and am working on patching aria-label & title attributes to docs & theme generator pages.

Just to be clear,  you're wanting me to only track components with btn-icon (both core library and site components) that relate to the docs i update, is that right? If so, i'll document and create an issue with them later if you'd like.

Also, should I patch sites/skeleton.dev/src/components/docs/Drawer.astro? I believe this is deprecated.

repository.description: Skeleton is an adaptive design system powered by Tailwind CSS.
repository.name: skeleton

summary.main: Demonstrate proper use of aria-label and title attributes for icon buttons, and scan the application for instances of 'btn-icon' to append these attributes.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The issue requires scanning all portions of the application for instances of 'btn-icon' and appending the aria-label and title attributes accordingly.
summary.attemptedFixes: The author has started working on patching aria-label & title attributes to docs & theme generator pages, and is considering tracking components with btn-icon usage.
summary.otherNotes: The issue is related to documenting proper use of aria-label and title attributes for icon buttons, and also scanning the application for instances of 'btn-icon' to append these attributes. A separate follow-up task is needed to add new props to components for proper i18n translations.

issueDTO.title: Update ESlinted acronyms
issueDTO.description:
## Feature Description

The list of acronyms that Site Kit enforces casing for should be reviewed and updated to make sure we're covering all the instances that it should be. Offending code is usually references from Google APIs. One such violation that isn't currently covered is `URI`, but there may be others we should add that have slipped by.

---------------

_Do not alter or remove anything below. The following sections will be managed by moderators only._

## Acceptance criteria

* The list of acronyms that Site Kit enforces casing for is updated to include the following additional acronyms::
  * `SDK` 
  * `EMM` 
  * `REST` 
  * `GKE` 
  * `URI`  
  * `UX`  
  * `OS` 
  * `GCP` 
  * `DNS`  
  * `FCM`  
  * `IAM` 
  * `IP` 
  * `ISO`

## Implementation Brief

* [x] In `packages/eslint-plugin/rules/acronym-case.js`
  * Expand the list of Acronyms to include the items listed in AC https://github.com/google/site-kit-wp/blob/3eacb691d9d832ac0f473f17e54c1bb581205a89/packages/eslint-plugin/rules/acronym-case.js#L108


### Test Coverage

* Include few new acronyms to the list of existing tests in `packages/eslint-plugin/rules/acronym-case.test.js`

## QA:Eng Brief

* Run unit tests for `acronym-case.js`.
* Confirm new acronyms (`SDK`, `EMM`, `REST`, `GKE`, `URI`, `UX`, `OS`, `GCP`, `DNS`, `FCM`, `IAM`, `IP`, `ISO`) are correctly flagged when casing is incorrect (e.g., `Sdk`).
* Verify new acronyms pass when casing is correct (e.g., `sdk`, `SDK_CONSTANT`).
* Ensure existing acronyms (e.g., `HTML`, `JSON`, `ID`) still behave as expected.
* Check that ignored cases (imports, function calls, global objects) continue to be ignored.


## Changelog entry

* N/A.

issueDTO.title: node-opcua-alarm-condition uses require('chalk') but does not list chalk in dependencies  markdown Copy Edit
issueDTO.description:
CURRENT BEHAVIOR
node-opcua-alarm-condition calls require("chalk") on its first line, but the published package.json (e.g. 2.156.0) does not declare chalk in dependencies.
When an application is installed with production-only flags (npm ci --omit=dev or npm ci --only=production) and no other top-level package depends on chalk, the process fails at startup with:

Error: Cannot find module 'chalk'
Require stack:

???/node-opcua-alarm-condition/dist/client_alarm_tools_dump_event.js

DESCRIBE THE BUG
Missing runtime dependency: chalk@4.x should be listed in dependencies so it is always present after a production install.

STEP BY STEP INSTRUCTION TO REPRODUCE

* Create a minimal project


issueDTO.title: Add switch for warm water circulation pump
issueDTO.description:
Would it be possible to add a switch for the warm water circulation pump?

Would be very usefull for energy conserving and demand driven (instead of time based) circulation control.

Could also help as a work around for manual thermal disinfection.
comments:
I solved that with an outlet (zigbee - zha) and a motion sensor.
I know that is not the smartest solution but it works

Right, there are many ways to control the circulation pump (or virtually any component) by external devices, but IMO that is not the point of this integration. Additionally, I prefer software solutions over altering the hardware whenever possible.

There is a point in the control menu where you can switch the pump manually for venting and I was wondering if that is reachable via the interface.

> Right, there are many ways to control the circulation pump (or virtually any component) by external devices, but IMO that is not the point of this integration. Additionally, I prefer software solutions over altering the hardware whenever possible.
> 
> There is a point in the control menu where you can switch the pump manually for venting and I was wondering if that is reachable via the interface. 

That would be awesome 👍 
I also tried to turn on the circulation pump outside the normal interval. But currently no success.
Do you know which luxtronik write command I have to send? Or how do I research of it?

> 
> Could also help as a work around for manual thermal disinfection.

I have learned from the author that thermal desinfection is just like any other water heating mode. Since then i don't care about how it is called, i just increase it whenever i want, especially when i have a lot of solar overproduction just to store more energy in the house. 

https://github.com/BenPru/luxtronik/issues/263
@apf-doit and how do you do it? Via luxtronik write command or custom automation? I have no entities, that set this mode directly.

@Gifford47 i have an entity named "number.luxtronik2_dhw_target_temperature" which basically is what it says it is: domestic water temperature. Combined with an automation checking the solar production and few other checks like current energy price, i increase the temp from default 45 to 60 and turn back when the temp is reached. The default desinfection target temp is actually 65, but with that entity i cannot set above 60, don't know why. But 60 is hot enough.

I have been using "ID_Einst_BWZIP_akt" for a while now to somewhat successfully turn off the hot water circulation pump. It's set to 0 by default and kind of disables it when set to 1. However the pump can still turn itself on sometimes and then run for even 20min non stop, ignoring the circulation timings settings. It usually happens after it's been off for a few hours.

Despite that it successfully reduces the energy usage. Usually by more than 50%.

> I have been using "ID_Einst_BWZIP_akt" for a while now to somewhat successfully turn off the hot water circulation pump. It's set to 0 by default and kind of disables it when set to 1. However the pump can still turn itself on sometimes and then run for even 20min non stop, ignoring the circulation timings settings. It usually happens after it's been off for a few hours.
> 
> Despite that it successfully reduces the energy usage. Usually by more than 50%.

May I ask how you disable or enable the hot water circulation pump? I think the "ID_Einst_BWZIP_akt" is not in the current implementation from BenPru. But I can add it via Bouni and YAML. right?

@Mehli12 
Yeah, looks like I managed it with the integration by Bouni.
I monitor it's state with a sensor added in the configuration file:
```
sensor:
  - platform: luxtronik
    sensors:
      - group: parameters
        id: ID_Einst_BWZIP_akt
        friendly_name: Circulation Pump
```

An change it's value with the `luxtronik.write` action:
```
action: luxtronik.write
data:
  parameter: ID_Einst_BWZIP_akt
  value: 1
```

However, the post I made actually inspired me to find a more reliable way to disable the circulation pump. I realized it could work more seamlessly with the heat pump if I used the integration to modify the circulation **schedule** instead of just turning it off directly.

With a bit of help from Gemini, I figured out the parameters used for the matrix that stores circulation start and end times (in seconds from midnight). The IDs follow this pattern:

**ID_Einst_SuZIP + Wo/25/Tg + _zeit_X_Y**

- The first part indicates it???s a schedule for the circulation pump.  
- The second part defines the type of schedule:  
  - `Wo` ??? same for every day  
  - `25` ??? different for weekends  
  - `Tg` ??? different for each day (just like in the heat pump settings)  
- The last part defines the coordinates in the matrix:  
  - `X` is the row (values 0???4)  
  - `Y` is the column:  
    - `0` = start time, `1` = end time for day 1  
    - `2` = start time, `3` = end time for day 2, and so on  

For example, `ID_Einst_SuZIP25_zeit_0_2` refers to the **start time for the weekend schedule on day 2**.

So, instead of completely disabling the circulation pump, I now modify the schedule based on presence. When everyone leaves, the schedule changes from the normal 6:00???00:00 to just **on at 6:00 and off at 6:15**. I use the same `luxtronik.write` action as before. This method has proven to be much more reliable for keeping the pump off when it???s not needed.

Additionally, if no one is home at 5:58, I change the schedule to end at **5:55**, and start at **5:50**, wait 18 minutes, then switch it back to the usual 6:00???6:15. I update the **end time first**. The system handles this well???even if the end time is earlier than the start time. For instance, if the start time is 6:00 and the end time is 5:00, the pump runs from 6:00 **until 5:00 the next day** and **doesn't run** from 5:00 to 6:00.

So I've been using that **instead of** `ID_Einst_BWZIP_akt` for the past few days and I think it's going to stay that way.
@BenPru is it possible to impliment this Switch into your Addon

When adding the entity, please provide a bit of documentation on how the parameter should be used. Some of these parameters are not very intuitive, can cause unexpected behavior or reduce the efficiency when not properly used. We really need to capture the information in this topic so it can be found again.

issueDTO.title: [MCP] Notion
issueDTO.description:
## 🧩 Product Overview  

Notion is a versatile workspace for notes, tasks, databases, wikis, and more. This integration empowers automation builders and AI agents to trigger workflows, manipulate content, sync databases, and maintain structured information across apps.

---

## ?????? Important Note for Contributors  

This Notion piece already exists in Activepieces. Your task is to extend the current piece by adding additional actions and triggers as outlined in the documentation and reference materials.

Please avoid duplicating existing functionality. Review the current implementation before making changes, and ensure that all new features follow existing coding patterns and standards.

---

## 🚨 Triggers  

| **Trigger** | **Use Case** |
|:--------------------------|:---------------------------------------|
| **New Comment** | Fires when a new comment is added on a page.|
| **Updated Page** | Trigger a sync process when documentation is updated.|

---

## 🛠??? Write Actions  

| **Action Item**               | **Use Case** |
|:--------------------------|:---------------------------------------|
| **Archive Database Item** | Soft-delete (archive) a database item. |
| **Restore Database Item** | Recover accidentally archived tasks.|
|**Add Comment**|Post a new comment to a page.|
|**Retrieve Database**|Build dynamic forms based on DB structure.|
|**Get Page Comments** | Fetches unresolved comments from page.|

---

## 🔍 Search Actions  

| **Action Item**               | **Use Case**                                                                                                                                     |
|:------------------------------|:-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| **Find Page** | Search for a page by title text, with exact-match option.|

---


## 📚 API Reference  
- [Official Notion API Documentation](https://developers.notion.com/reference/intro)

---

## 🧪 Test Account Access  
Sign up for a free Notion account at https://www.notion.so/.

---

## 🧑???💻 New to Activepieces?

Activepieces is the leading open source AI automation platform. We have many apps (we call them Pieces), that are available within the builder and as MCPs. These apps are built with our TypeScript framework and are easy to develop. Once merged into our repository, they become available as pieces in our automation builder and as MCPs usable by AI agents and MCP clients.

Start building here: [Piece Development Docs](https://www.activepieces.com/docs/developers/building-pieces/overview)

issueDTO.title: [Margin app] Add admin filter
issueDTO.description:
## Guideline
1. Carefully read the issue description before applying to ensure you have all the necessary information to start working on it.
2. Write a brief description of how you will approach the task (without using ChatGPT).
3. Add your Telegram handler in your application (e.g., in OnlyDust or similar)
4. Write ETA in your application



## What should I do if I have a problem
1. Try to google it before asking. Googling is taking major part of dev work 
2. If you couldn't find answer your question with Google, text your question to [dev](https://t.me/spotnet_dev/4) group with your question.
3. Do not send DM to maintainer, it would be better and faster to ask other contributors in chat 


## How to prepare PR
1. Check if your code [smell](https://refactoring.guru/refactoring/smells) good
2. Add `close #<issue number>` to link your issue with your PR
3. Do not commit changes that are unrelated to your task
4. Check after you created PR, if you committed everything


## Task Description
1. In the [filters folder](./blob/main/margin/margin_app/app/telegram/filters), create a new admin filter that checks the user ID against `ADMIN_IDS` from the settings. If it matches, return `True`.
2. Create a new handler in [this folder](./blob/main/margin/margin_app/app/telegram/handlers), for example `/admin_check`, that replies with a message like `You are an admin!` or `You aren???t an admin!`, or a similar message conveying the same meaning.

## Guideline

1. Try to google it before asking. Googling is taking major part of dev work 
2. If you couldn't find answer your question with Google, text your question to [dev](https://t.me/spotnet_dev/4) group with your question.

1. Check if your code [smell](https://refactoring.guru/refactoring/smells) good

3. Do not commit changes that are unrelated to your task

issueDTO.title: [feat][mockServer] add HTTPS support
issueDTO.description:
https://www.mock-server.com/mock_server/HTTPS_TLS.html
- MockServer has support for TLS (i.e. HTTPS) for inbound connections

But there is no way to configure it in testcontainers module.
comments:
I can work on this!

I've discovered that the current version of `@testcontainers/mockserver` already supports HTTPS ([example script](https://github.com/botflux/testing-issue-1023) illustrating an HTTPS request).

The only missing piece is a method to create the HTTPS URL to be used by the SUT.
[`getUrl`](https://github.com/testcontainers/testcontainers-node/blob/c527aa04165f6c64c3dd72c1d749a102c540802f/packages/modules/mockserver/src/mockserver-container.ts#L7C1-L10C4) returns an HTTP, so I could add a `getHttpsUrl`.
Or, I could update the existing with a flag `getUrl(useHttps: boolean = false)`.

Note that mockserver generates a self-signed certificate, so the tests must be run 
with the `NODE_TLS_REJECT_UNAUTHORIZED=0` flag.

What dou you think @cristianrgreco ?

Sound great @botflux. 

I've had a look at the testcontainers-java implementation, and they have `getEndpoint` and `getSecureEndpoint`. As we already have `getUrl`, I think `getSecureUrl` makes some sense. WDYT?
Yep, it sounds good! I'm gonna open a PR!

summary.main: Add HTTPS support to testcontainers module, specifically to create an HTTPS URL to be used by the SUT.
summary.validationOrRequirement: Add HTTPS support to testcontainers module, specifically to create an HTTPS URL to be used by the SUT.
summary.attemptedFixes: Consider adding a `getHttpsUrl` method or updating the existing `getUrl` method with a flag `getUrl(useHttps: boolean = false)`. Also, looking at the testcontainers-java implementation, `getSecureUrl` makes sense.
summary.otherNotes: MockServer has support for TLS (i.e. HTTPS) for inbound connections, but there is no way to configure it in testcontainers module. Note that mockserver generates a self-signed certificate, so the tests must be run with the `NODE_TLS_REJECT_UNAUTHORIZED=0` flag.

issueDTO.title: Add support for LeaderWorkerSet
issueDTO.description:
### What you would like to be added?

Currently, KAI has not integration with the LeaderWorkerSet (https://github.com/kubernetes-sigs/lws). 

To add this feature, an appropriate plugin should be created in the pod-grouper.
This plugin should create a podGroup for each LeaderWorkerSet group.
The plugin also needs to be able to support both kind of StartUpPolicy (https://github.com/kubernetes-sigs/lws/blob/2d6ffb2d1c0bc511914648c4a230f429a2a63a8b/api/leaderworkerset/v1/leaderworkerset_types.go#L312)

### Why is this needed?

The LeaderWorkerSet has been gaining traction as a good crd for managing several groups of pods. This solution allows for better leader-worker groups managment then defining a framework-spesific spec or a map of replicaSet templates.
comments:
More info on PodGrouper plugins is available here:
https://github.com/NVIDIA/KAI-Scheduler/blob/main/docs/developer/pod-grouper.md
@itsomri, please provide some guidelines here.
Hey @davidLif & @romanbaron, I would love to contribute here. I need some guidance to get started.

Hello @singh1203, 👋 
Thank you for taking ownership of this task.

To enable LWS support within the KAI Scheduler, you will be implementing a new PodGrouper plugin. This component is responsible for abstracting various workload types into PodGroups prior to scheduling.

The initial implementation steps are as follows:
1. Develop a new PodGrouper plugin that inspects the LWS instance and generates PodGroupMetadata:
    a. minAvailable should likely be derived from the leaderWorkerTemplate.
    b. The podGroup owner should probably be the leader pod.
    c. Set the default priority class to inference.
    For reference, you may review the AzureML plugin implementation: [AzureML Plugin Example](https://github.com/NVIDIA/KAI-Scheduler/blob/bac4866ab5bba39cc76e900ced0c1da31339a4a1/pkg/podgrouper/podgrouper/plugins/aml/aml_grouper.go)

2. Register the new plugin within the PodGrouper hub: [PodGrouper Hub Registration](https://github.com/NVIDIA/KAI-Scheduler/blob/bac4866ab5bba39cc76e900ced0c1da31339a4a1/pkg/podgrouper/podgrouper/hub/hub.go#L88)

3. Generate the necessary RBAC resources by executing make manifests. This will update the kai-podgrouper ClusterRole to include the appropriate permissions for LWS.

Additional documentation on extending the PodGrouper functionality is available here:
[PodGrouper Plugin Development Guide](https://github.com/NVIDIA/KAI-Scheduler/blob/main/docs/developer/pod-grouper.md)

Please let me know if any clarification is needed.

Hi @singh1203 ,

That's great! Are you plan to start working on this in the next few days? 
I am planing to start writing the e2e tests for this feature tommorow. We can connect over email (mine is dlifshitz@nvidia.com) an we colaborate 😄 

Yours,
David

Hi @davidLif & @romanbaron,

Thanks so much for the detailed guidance and for the opportunity to contribute! 🙌

I???m currently going through the resources and plugin examples you shared to get a better understanding of how everything fits together. Since I contribute to open source in my free time outside of office hours, I may need a bit of time to ramp up and make steady progress, but I???m definitely excited to work on this.

@davidLif, I???d love to collaborate! I???ll drop you an email soon so we can stay in sync as I dig deeper into the implementation. Looking forward to contributing to this feature together! 😄

Best regards,
Saurabh

Hi @singh1203 and @davidLif 👋 

Thank you for all the hard work you???ve put into this integration ??? it???s greatly appreciated 🙏 

One of the teams now has a growing need for this, and I???d like to align on a clear date for when the LWS integration will be available in KAI. Would it be feasible to target merging it before July 15th? If it???s helpful, we could also agree on a near-term milestone for the initial integration and handle any remaining items post-merge.

If you???re tied up or have blockers you can???t resolve in time, just say the word and I will assist driving it across the finish line.

> Hi [@singh1203](https://github.com/singh1203) and [@davidLif](https://github.com/davidLif) 👋
> 
> Thank you for all the hard work you???ve put into this integration ??? it???s greatly appreciated 🙏

Would it be feasible to target merging it before July 15th? If it???s helpful, we could also agree on a near-term milestone for the initial integration and handle any remaining items post-merge.

Hi! @romanbaron  Thank you for the support and the clear timeline. The LWS integration is nearly complete from my end - the core functionality is implemented and working. The only current blocker is that the test suite for leaderworkersets is being skipped, even when using the --test-third-party-integrations flag.
I've verified that the CRD is properly defined and the test code includes the appropriate skip condition check (crd.SkipIfCrdIsNotInstalled), but I'm having trouble identifying why the tests aren't executing. Meeting the July 15th target is definitely feasible once we resolve this testing issue.

issueDTO.title: `ValueError` raised by `FeatureUnion._set_output` with `FunctionTransform` that outputs a pandas `Series` in scikit-learn version 1.6
issueDTO.description:
### Describe the bug

Hello,

I'm currently working with scikit-learn version 1.6, and I encountered a regression that wasn't present in version 1.4.

The following minimal code computes two features ??? the cumulative mean of age and weight grouped by id. Each transformation function returns a pandas.Series:



When I run this code with scikit-learn 1.6, I get the following error:

After investigation, I found that the issue occurs because each transformer returns a Series, not a DataFrame. If I update the functions to return DataFrame objects instead, the error disappears.

Interestingly, in scikit-learn 1.4, the same code works correctly even when the functions return Series.


Do you have any explanation for why this changed between version 1.4 and 1.6 ?

Thanks in advance for your help!

### Steps/Code to Reproduce


```python
import pandas as pd
from sklearn.pipeline import FunctionTransformer, FeatureUnion
import numpy as np

def compute_cumulative_mean_age(df: pd.DataFrame) -> pd.Series:
    return (
        df["age"]
        .astype(float)
        .groupby(df["id"])
        .expanding()
        .mean()
        .droplevel(level="id")
        .reindex(df.index)
        .rename("cumulative_mean_age")
    )

def compute_cumulative_mean_weight(df: pd.DataFrame) -> pd.Series:
    return (
        df["poids"]
        .astype(float)
        .groupby(df["id"])
        .expanding()
        .mean()
        .droplevel(level="id")
        .reindex(df.index)
        .rename("cumulative_mean_weight")
    )

def compute_features(df: pd.DataFrame) -> pd.DataFrame:
    feature_union = FeatureUnion(
        [
            ("cumulative_mean_age", FunctionTransformer(compute_cumulative_mean_age)),
            ("cumulative_mean_weight", FunctionTransformer(compute_cumulative_mean_weight))
        ]
    ).set_output(transform="pandas")

    return feature_union.fit_transform(X=df).astype(float)

def transform(df: pd.DataFrame) -> pd.DataFrame:
    return compute_features(df)

if __name__ == "__main__":
    np.random.seed(42)
    df = pd.DataFrame({
        'id': [1, 2, 3, 1, 4, 5, 6, 6, 7, 8],
        'age': np.random.randint(18, 70, size=10),
        'poids': np.random.randint(50, 100, size=10)
    })

    print(transform(df))
```

### Expected Results

```pytb
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "C:\Users\XXX\PycharmProjects\fraude_detection_pec_audio\tmp.py", line 73, in <module>
    print(transform(df=df))
          ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  File "C:\Users\XXX\PycharmProjects\fraude_detection_pec_audio\tmp.py", line 55, in transform
    return compute_features(
           ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  File "C:\Users\XXX\PycharmProjects\fraude_detection_pec_audio\tmp.py", line 45, in compute_features
    .fit_transform(
     ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  File "C:\Users\XXX\PycharmProjects\fraude_detection_pec_audio\.venv\Lib\site-packages\sklearn\utils\_set_output.py", line 332, in wrapped
    return _wrap_data_with_container(method, data_to_wrap, X, self)
           ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  File "C:\Users\XXX\PycharmProjects\fraude_detection_pec_audio\.venv\Lib\site-packages\sklearn\utils\_set_output.py", line 307, in _wrap_data_with_container
    return adapter.create_container(
           ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  File "C:\Users\XXX\PycharmProjects\fraude_detection_pec_audio\.venv\Lib\site-packages\sklearn\utils\_set_output.py", line 135, in create_container
    X_output = _create_pandas_dataframe_from_non_pandas_container(
               ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  File "C:\Users\XXX\PycharmProjects\fraude_detection_pec_audio\.venv\Lib\site-packages\sklearn\utils\fixes.py", line 428, in _create_pandas_dataframe_from_non_pandas_container
    return pd.DataFrame(X, index=index, copy=copy)
           ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  File "C:\Users\XXX\PycharmProjects\fraude_detection_pec_audio\.venv\Lib\site-packages\pandas\core\frame.py", line 722, in __init__
    mgr = ndarray_to_mgr(
          ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  File "C:\Users\XXX\PycharmProjects\fraude_detection_pec_audio\.venv\Lib\site-packages\pandas\core\internals\construction.py", line 349, in ndarray_to_mgr
    _check_values_indices_shape_match(values, index, columns)
  File "C:\Users\XXX\PycharmProjects\fraude_detection_pec_audio\.venv\Lib\site-packages\pandas\core\internals\construction.py", line 420, in _check_values_indices_shape_match
    raise ValueError(f"Shape of passed values is {passed}, indices imply {implied}")
ValueError: Shape of passed values is (20, 1), indices imply (10, 1)
```

### Actual Results

```pytb
    raise ValueError(f"Shape of passed values is {passed}, indices imply {implied}")
ValueError: Shape of passed values is (20, 1), indices imply (10, 1)
```

### Versions

```shell
sklearn: 1.6.0
numpy: 1.26.4
pandas: 1.5.3
```
comments:
I would argue that the previous beahviour worked by chance but it was a bug. Scikit-learn transformers API expect to return an array of shape `(n_samples, n_features)`. Having a single dimension is really ambiguous because we cannot guess if it is a single sample or a single feature. For instance, if you use `set_output(transform="default")`, then you will get an array of shape `(20,)` where I would argue that the `FeatureUnion` failed.

So here, I think that the fact that we raise an error is actually fine. The error message is a bit tricky thought. The fact it does not raise with `set_output(transform="default")` is actually annoying I think.

So one way would be to validate the output of `FunctionTransformer` being sure it should be 2-D. However, we sometime want this transformer to be lenient so I wonder if the behaviour should be driven by a parameter, similarly to the `validate` parameter but for the output.

@jeremiedbb @ogrisel do you have any thoughts regarding if `FunctionTransformer` should be permissive regarding the shape of the output or if we should strictly follow the API of other transformers.

I'm thinking that we usually want this transformer to be permissive on the input side.

Note that the mentioned code already raises 2 informative warnings before raising the final exception:

```python
/Users/ogrisel/code/scikit-learn/sklearn/preprocessing/_function_transformer.py:311: UserWarning: When `set_output` is configured to be 'pandas', `func` should return a pandas DataFrame to follow the `set_output` API  or `feature_names_out` should be defined.
  warnings.warn(warn_msg.format("pandas"))
/Users/ogrisel/code/scikit-learn/sklearn/preprocessing/_function_transformer.py:311: UserWarning: When `set_output` is configured to be 'pandas', `func` should return a pandas DataFrame to follow the `set_output` API  or `feature_names_out` should be defined.
  warnings.warn(warn_msg.format("pandas"))
```

The function transformer should not return a pandas series but a pandas dataframe.

Maybe we could change this to accept series and automatically wrap them as dataframes because there is no ambiguity in this particular case.

If not, I agree that we should at least improve the error message.

Let me try to simplify the reproducer to make it minimal.

Here is a minimal reproducer:

```python
import pandas as pd
from sklearn.preprocessing import FunctionTransformer
from sklearn.pipeline import FeatureUnion


data = pd.DataFrame(dict(a=range(3), b=range(3)))
FeatureUnion(
    [
        ("a", FunctionTransformer(lambda df: df["a"])),
        ("b", FunctionTransformer(lambda df: df["b"])),  # exception not raised if you remove this line.
    ]
).set_output(transform="pandas").fit_transform(data)
```

Note that the `FeatureUnion` requires 2 series, otherwise there are no exceptions, only the warnings.

Actually, here is the real bug in my opinion: if you remove the `.set_output("pandas")` from the above snippet, the code works without failing or raising warnings but outputs meaningless results:

```python
import pandas as pd
from sklearn.preprocessing import FunctionTransformer
from sklearn.pipeline import FeatureUnion


data = pd.DataFrame(dict(a=range(3), b=range(3)))
FeatureUnion(
    [
        ("a", FunctionTransformer(lambda df: df["a"])),
        ("b", FunctionTransformer(lambda df: df["b"])),
    ]
).fit_transform(data)
```
```
array([0, 1, 2, 0, 1, 2])
```

Instead, `FeatureUnion` should raise an explicit error message to make it explicit that some transformers output 1d data-structures instead of the expected 2d.

I think the `FeatureUnion._hstack` method should be changed to raise an informative error message if some elements in `Xs` are not 2D data-structures. We should also check that their `.shape[0]` match the expected number of samples measured on the `X` parameter passed to `FeatureUnion.transform` or `FeatureUnion.fit_transform`.

EDIT: the error message of the exception should mention the name of the transformer that generated invalid output shapes along with the observed shape and the expected number of data points.
hello i am Ahsan , i am new to open source , i would like to contribute .
/take

Hi @Nafeessidd1 , I noticed you've claimed this issue recently. I'm new to open source and was interested in contributing. Would you be open to collaborating, or should I look for another issue? No worries either way ??? thanks!

Hi!  @MohammedSaim-Quadri 👋 Thanks for reaching out ??? and welcome to open source! I'd be more than happy to collaborate on this issue or any other issue. Let???s work on it together and split things up if needed. Feel free to share your thoughts or let me know if you???ve already started exploring a solution. Looking forward to working with you!

repository.description: scikit-learn: machine learning in Python
repository.name: scikit-learn

summary.main: The issue is about a regression in scikit-learn version 1.6, where the FeatureUnion transformer raises a ValueError when the output of FunctionTransformer is a pandas Series instead of a DataFrame.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The output of FunctionTransformer should be a 2D data structure (array or DataFrame) with shape (n_samples, n_features).
summary.attemptedFixes: The author has suggested that the behavior should be driven by a parameter, similarly to the validate parameter, but for the output. They also suggested that the function transformer should not return a pandas series but a pandas dataframe.
summary.otherNotes: This issue is related to the change in scikit-learn version 1.6, where the FeatureUnion transformer expects output to be a DataFrame, not a Series. The author of the issue has suggested that the previous behavior was a bug and that the error message should be improved.

issueDTO.title: Remove dependency on enzyme
issueDTO.description:
Enzyme is not compatible with React 18, so we need to phase it out.

Preferred approach is to migrate to `react-testing-library`. In some cases we may use a replacement `shallow` function #1653, but only when absolutely necessary, it's better to move away from snapshot testing.
  * https://testing-library.com/docs/react-testing-library/migrate-from-enzyme
  * https://medium.com/zipyai/migrating-from-enzyme-to-react-testing-library-b1fb607d81ab

For examples of this being partially done, see merged PRs in this ticket below (e.g. #1659 #1653 #1643).

The scope of this is sizeable, so the **recommendation is to limit the changes to specific modules**, a couple test files at a time.

Current enzyme references (July 4 2025):
```
$ grep -rl 'import.*enzyme' packages/jaeger-ui/src
packages/jaeger-ui/src/components/Monitor/ServicesView/index.test.js
packages/jaeger-ui/src/components/QualityMetrics/index.test.js
packages/jaeger-ui/src/components/TraceDiff/TraceDiffHeader/TraceDiffHeader.test.js
packages/jaeger-ui/src/components/TraceDiff/TraceDiff.test.js
packages/jaeger-ui/src/components/TracePage/TraceSpanView/index.test.js
packages/jaeger-ui/src/components/TracePage/index.test.js
packages/jaeger-ui/src/components/TracePage/TracePageHeader/SpanGraph/ViewingLayer.test.js
packages/jaeger-ui/src/components/TracePage/TraceTimelineViewer/VirtualizedTraceView.test.js
packages/jaeger-ui/src/components/SearchTracePage/SearchResults/index.test.js
packages/jaeger-ui/src/components/SearchTracePage/index.test.js
packages/jaeger-ui/src/components/SearchTracePage/SearchForm.test.js

$ grep -rl 'import.*enzyme' packages/jaeger-ui/src | wc -l
      11
```
comments: I want to work on this @yurishkuro. Can you assign it to me please? Will be a very good start for me
We do not assign issues. There are multiple packages that are affected, don't try to change all in one PR.
@yurishkuro Any previous discussion that  I should not miss, execpt the mentioned ones.

I also want to work on this. There are several test files, so I think we can split the task between us, @Sangam-ghimire. Please let me know if you want to handle all the files alone because if we both work on same files, it will waste time for both of us.
Thanks
Sure @AbhishekTiwari23 that's a great spirit. Let's split and work together. I might need some help too.

@Sangam-ghimire @AbhishekTiwari23 Please have a look at the discussion among the PRs: https://github.com/jaegertracing/jaeger-ui/pull/1659 https://github.com/jaegertracing/jaeger-ui/pull/1653 https://github.com/jaegertracing/jaeger-ui/pull/1643
It would help you understand the issue's landscape.

https://testing-library.com/docs/react-testing-library/migrate-from-enzyme 
https://medium.com/zipyai/migrating-from-enzyme-to-react-testing-library-b1fb607d81ab
you can refer these @Sangam-ghimire @AbhishekTiwari23
Thanks, working on it

> Thanks, working on it

Have you started?
I am working over here https://github.com/jaegertracing/jaeger-ui/tree/main/packages/jaeger-ui/src/components/App is that fine
Now i am thinking to work on components/DeepDependencies

Hi! I have been migrating some files to RTL, and one common pattern that I keep stumbling upon is using snapshots in testing. Have any tests been migrated from `enzyme` to `RTL` containing snapshots, or should I research the same and propose a way forward? 

The reason I'm saying this is due to [the bulky snapshots generated by RTL and the fact that it is built to test for user interactions, and not necessarily the rendered DOM.](https://thesametech.com/snapshot-testing-in-rtl/)

cc: @anshgoyalevil @yurishkuro

@EshaanAgg in many cases snapshot testing is just lazy tests. Ideally we want to move away from those to more explicit tests like the two you fixed today. But we do have a shortcut that still allows to use snapshots without enzyme, as in #1653.
Ahh, I got it. I'll try to experiment with the tests and see if we can move away from them in some components.
I'd raise a PR for `packages/jaeger-ui/src/components/QualityMetrics/` shortly.

I've been trying to finish https://github.com/jaegertracing/jaeger-ui/pull/2651.
The enzyme tests cannot deal with the automatic jsx transform of React 19.
So, this migration needs to happen before React 19 can be used.

I'm interested in contributing to Migrate ResultItem tests (#2742) and assisting with the transition from Enzyme to React Testing Library, leveraging my React expertise, debugging skills, and prior experience improving Jaeger UI.
Huge progress since May, from 53 to just 11 tests remaining

issueDTO.title: Optimise performance of var-args functions by adding loop-unrolled variants
issueDTO.description:
### Is your feature request related to a problem?

There are a variety of `MultiArgFunction` functions, with variable argument lists. Often, these lists will be short (<5 arguments), but there is no guarantee that the JVM will unroll their loops automatically.

Functions that perform relatively simple operations may benefit from manually unrolled variants that skip loop and conditional checks, and instead have a straight bytecode path for the calculations.



### Describe the solution you'd like.

Review var-args functions, particularly those with numeric arguments and basic calculations. If they are a candidate for loop unrolling, implement and benchmark to prove it is faster.

Examples of var-args functions:

- greatest/least
- IN
- CASE
- coalesce
- ~l2price~
- concat

### Describe alternatives you've considered.

_No response_

### Full Name:

Nick Woolmer

### Affiliation:

QuestDB

### Additional context

_No response_
comments:
Hi, I would like to contribrute to solving this issue, it seems like you would like to take functions with multiple arguments and create standard versions where we would know the number of arguments beforehand and we can save time by not looping on the variables. I believe I can help with this issue with at least these function:

greatest/least
IN
CASE
l2price
concat

Is this issue still open? If so can you assign it to me? I'll try solving it. I am trying to start adding to open-source contribrutions so I think this would be a great beginner experience. Is there a specific timeframe you want this issue to be finished by?
For sure, go for it. `l2price` already has unrolled variants, so you can use that as a reference of what can be achieved for the other functions.
@nwoolmer , Could you please assign this task to me if it hasn???t been picked up yet? Thank you!
hi solution published on https://github.com/questdb/questdb/pull/5870 please review it

### Prerequisites
1. Be a member of Hack for LA. (There are no fees to join.) If you have not joined yet, please follow the steps on our [Getting Started](https://www.hackforla.org/getting-started) page and attend an onboarding session.
2. You have already read our [How to Contribute to Hack for LA Guide](https://github.com/hackforla/website/blob/gh-pages/CONTRIBUTING.md).

### Overview
We need to keep project information up to date so that visitors to the website can find accurate information.

### Action Items

```
    role: Merge Team
    links:

```

summary.validationOrRequirement: The issue requires a feature that allows users to zoom in for detailed inspection while maintaining the ability to see the full overview, with the requirement of including the dropdown compact (one-liner) and adding functionality for pinch-to-zoom on touch devices and mouse wheel zoom support.
summary.attemptedFixes: Implementing dynamic node scaling that adjusts node size based on zoom level, combined with zoom presets for quick access to different detail levels, and adding functionality for pinch-to-zoom on touch devices and mouse wheel zoom support.
summary.otherNotes: The issue is about improving the readability of the tree view for remote and staged workloads by visualizing all objects, with proposed solutions such as dynamic node scaling and zoom presets, and a preview of the expected outcome.

issueDTO.title: rootcp --replace option ineffective
issueDTO.description:
rootcp helps says:
```
  --replace             replace object if already existing
 ```
but:
```
rm copy.root
rootcp -r --replace tutorials/hsimple.root copy.root;
root.exe -b -l copy.root -e 'gFile->ls()' -q
rootcp -r --replace tutorials/hsimple.root copy.root; 
root.exe -b -l copy.root -e 'gFile->ls()' -q
```
leads to:
```
pcanal@Viroflay:~/root_working/build/master-debug$ rm copy.root 
pcanal@Viroflay:~/root_working/build/master-debug$ rootcp -r --replace tutorials/hsimple.root copy.root; root.exe -b -l copy.root -e 'gFile->ls()' -q

Attaching file copy.root as _file0...
(TFile *) 0x5645f4423530
TFile**         copy.root
 TFile*         copy.root
  KEY: TH1F     hpx;1   This is the px distribution
  KEY: TH2F     hpxpy;1 py vs px
  KEY: TProfile hprof;1 Profile of pz versus px
  KEY: TNtuple  ntuple;1        Demo ntuple
pcanal@Viroflay:~/root_working/build/master-debug$ rootcp -r --replace tutorials/hsimple.root copy.root; root.exe -b -l copy.root -e 'gFile->ls()' -q

Attaching file copy.root as _file0...
(TFile *) 0x55f09c1bbc50
TFile**         copy.root
 TFile*         copy.root
  KEY: TH1F     hpx;2   This is the px distribution [current cycle]
  KEY: TH1F     hpx;1   This is the px distribution [backup cycle]
  KEY: TH2F     hpxpy;2 py vs px [current cycle]
  KEY: TH2F     hpxpy;1 py vs px [backup cycle]
  KEY: TProfile hprof;2 Profile of pz versus px [current cycle]
  KEY: TProfile hprof;1 Profile of pz versus px [backup cycle]
  KEY: TNtuple  ntuple;1        Demo ntuple
```

seemingly addition rather than replacement.
comments:
This should be easy to fix. It is not generally ineffective, but only if you use the recursive option and not specify object names at the same time. This already works:
```txt
rootcp -r --replace tutorials/hsimple.root:hpx copy.root:hpx;
```

repository.description: The official repository for ROOT: analyzing, storing and visualizing big data, scientifically
repository.name: root

summary.main: The --replace option of the rootcp command is ineffective, as it does not replace the object if already existing, but instead adds a new one.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The --replace option should replace the object if already existing, but it seems to be adding instead.
summary.attemptedFixes: The recursive option and not specifying object names at the same time, as shown in the working solution.
summary.otherNotes: The issue is not generally ineffective, but only if you use the recursive option and not specify object names at the same time. A working solution is provided, using the recursive option and specifying object names at the same time.

issueDTO.title: [Bug] "Add to Chat": Discrepancy between displayed line reference and actual code processed by AI
issueDTO.description:
1. Press `Cmd+Shift+P` in Void, and type `Help: About`. Please paste the information here. Also let us know any other relevant details, like the model and provider you're using if applicable.
??????: 1.99.30033 (system setup)
??????: 1.3.9
??????: b7bb7f2f949a5267274d184a2b7665dc4aa05112
Electron: 2025-05-14T06:04:52.797Z
ElectronBuildId: 34.3.2
Chromium: undefined
Node.js: 132.0.6834.210
V8: 20.18.3
OS: 13.2.152.41-electron.0
2. Describe the issue/feature here!
When selecting a portion of code in the editor with the mouse and then clicking the "Add to Chat" button, the AI chat window might correctly display a reference to the selected line numbers. However, based on the AI's response or its subsequent behavior, it appears to have actually read, processed, or understood a different segment of code, not the code the user actually selected. As shown in the attached screenshot, the chat window's reference points to the selected lines 35-37, but the AI's understanding seems to be based on the content of lines 31-33.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/d0acf52e-c423-4f44-a837-c7c2fdac4a00)

After multiple attempts, I found that there is a certain probability of correct application, but in many cases, reference errors still occur.
comments:
Thanks for the report! We're currently getting the file contents of the selection when you click send, not when you attach the message. I think that's the problem.
This makes sense for full files, but we should probably do it the other way for CodeSelections (line-numbered). Will leave this open
Hi, can I work on this ?
@andrewpareles @vrtnis ?
@praburocking sounds great.. feel free to take this on!

summary.main: The 'Add to Chat' feature displays a discrepancy between the displayed line reference and the actual code processed by the AI when selecting a portion of code in the editor and clicking the 'Add to Chat' button.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The issue should be fixed by obtaining the file contents of the selection when attaching the message, rather than when clicking send.
summary.attemptedFixes: The problem is likely due to the file contents of the selection being obtained when clicking send, not when attaching the message. This is a known issue for full files, but it should be addressed for CodeSelections (line-numbered).
summary.otherNotes: The issue is related to the 'Add to Chat' feature and the discrepancy between the displayed line reference and the actual code processed by the AI. The issue is reproducible, but there is a probability of correct application.

issueDTO.title: Launchpad: Fix broken internal links #3
issueDTO.description:
**This task has been created for UbuCon EU (OpenSouthCode 2025) to assist community members make their first documentation contribution.**

Background
------------------
Internal references/links point to pages within the same doc-set, i.e., don't take you to an external site. Some pages in the Launchpad manual have broken internal links because they have been recently migrated from another site and are yet to be correctly linked to each other. Launchpad's docs are now hosted on Read the Docs and are written in restructured text or markdown. When linking these docs, it is recommended that the [:ref: method](https://canonical-starter-pack.readthedocs-hosted.com/latest/reference/style-guide/#internal-references) described in the style guide be used. Using :ref: instead of a file path makes it less likely that the link will break if a file is renamed or moved to a different folder.

Task
-------
The page linked below has one or more broken internal links. Direct the links to the correct pages within the docs using the :ref: method mentioned above. You may need to add a target to a file you're linking to if one is not already present.

[your-launchpad-account](https://documentation.ubuntu.com/launchpad/en/latest/user/explanation/your-launchpad-account/)
comments: Hi @odadacharles I've submitted a PR, addressing this task, please if something needs to be improved, just let me know.

repository.description: Learn open-source software documentation skills with Canonical
repository.name: open-documentation-academy

summary.main: Fix broken internal links in the Launchpad manual by redirecting them to the correct pages using the :ref: method.
summary.validationOrRequirement: Use the :ref: method to link internal pages within the Launchpad manual, and add a target to a file if one is not already present.
summary.attemptedFixes: A PR has been submitted by @odadacharles addressing the task, and the author is open to feedback.
summary.otherNotes: The task is related to UbuCon EU (OpenSouthCode 2025) and is intended for community members to make their first documentation contribution.

issueDTO.title: LinkRank: PageRank for edges
issueDTO.description:
**What is the feature or improvement you would like to see?**

Implement LinkRank, which is the equivalent of PageRank: what fraction of its time does a random walker spend on each edge?

This is already implemented in IGraph/M.

**Use cases for the feature**

This is a straightforward to implement edge centrality measure.

**Implementation**

Please see the comments in the IGraph/M docs (in references). The steps are:

 1. Compute PageRank
 2. For each vertex `v`, set the LinkRank of each of its outgoing edges `e` to `pagerank(v) * weight(e) / strength(v)`.

**References**

 - https://arxiv.org/abs/0902.3728
 - http://szhorvat.net/mathematica/IGDocumentation/#linkrank
comments: Hi  @szhorvat I would like to work on this enhancement. Thanks

I prefer this to be done one a separate branch that can be merged into `develop` when it's done. Re the reordering: yes, the guidelines should be followed for the 1.0 version if we have time for that before the release of 1.0 (whose release date is quite uncertain at the moment due to the funding situation), but I would not consider this as a blocker for 1.0.
Alright. I'll do the reordering on `develop`, and then this PR can be targeted onto `develop`. Of course all PRs must be from separate branches.

@Ravikiran-Bhonagiri Would you be able to do some groundwork first and clean up the PageRank function interfaces?

First, the parameters of PageRank function should be reordered like this:

```
igraph_error_t igraph_personalized_pagerank(
    const igraph_t *graph,
    const igraph_vector_t *weights,
    const igraph_vector_t *reset,
    igraph_vector_t *vector,
    igraph_real_t *value,
    const igraph_vs_t vids,
    igraph_real_t damping,
    igraph_bool_t directed,
    igraph_pagerank_algo_t algo,
    igraph_arpack_options_t *options)
```

`igraph_personalized_pagerank_vs()` and `igraph_pagerank()` should follow the same order.

All calls to the functions (library, tests, benchmarks), as well as the documentation should also be updated.

Second, the `igraph_bool_t directed` parameter should be replaced by an `igraph_neimode_t mode` parameter. This means we need to add support for using either an OUT or an IN mode.

These two changes can be made in a single PR that should be targeted on the `develop` branch (not `master`).

One this is done, we are ready for LinkRank.

Let me know if you would like to get started with this work.

Sure, I will have a look and work.

Thanks
Ravikiran Bhonagiri

issueDTO.title: Add a "Clear all" option in the history screen
issueDTO.description:
# Context
A user may want to delete all history entries

# Solution
Provide an option to delete all entries

# Acceptance criteria
1. In the history screen, add a new three dots (context) menu and a "Clear all" option
    a. This menu item should never be visible in the toolbar, only in the context menu.
2. When the "Clear all" option is clicked, show a dialog with the following properties
  - Title: Delete history confirmation
  - Description: Are you sure you want to delete all activity history entries? This action is irreversible.
  - Positive button: Delete
  - Neutral button: Dismiss
3. When the "Delete" button is clicked, clear all activities and their associated actions (the "activities" and the "actions" tables, in that order, to avoid foreign key reference issues).
comments:
Hi I was looking for a repository to make my first contribution to open source.
My experience with Android app development is that I have done school assignments which the most relevant one was a MVP CRM app for a startup. 
I was wondering if I could work on this issue?

Hey @A-N-07, thanks for expressing your interest. If you're still interested, feel free to go ahead - Let me know in this issue thread and I'll assign it to you. See #81 for a related feature and #90 for the PR that implemented it.

issueDTO.title: bug: unix_addr check is useless
comments:
I'm not entirely sure about the original design intention for this validator. It might have been intended to validate input values exclusively for the 'Unix' network. However, it would be beneficial to extend its functionality to also handle `unixgram` and `unixpacket` networks. 

We always welcome pull requests with improvements or fixes.

I suggest creating a new `socket` validator and implementing it with the approach you provided.

A "socket" does not inherently mean a UDS/IPC socket. `tcp,127.0.0.1:1234` is a "socket".

If anything, it explicitly should be called "ipc" ("Inter-Process Communication") or "uds" (UNIX Domain Socket).

`socket` as a validator name should be applicable to all of the above cases (see also #1327).

I went through the issue. @nf-brentsaner is right about the fact that socket can mean many things(tcp, uds, etc). So it probably will not be a good idea to name the validator as 'socket' if it just validates UDS. 
I think we have a few options here 
1. We could just build an UDS validator and name it as UDS or IPC
2. We could try building a proper Socket validator ( supporting tcp,uds etc). But that will involve adding support for quite a lot of socket types.
3. We could try incrementally adding validation for each socket types for example an UDS validator a TCP validator and so on.

I propose we build out the socket validations for each type one by one. Once we are confident we have considered all cases we can debate about if we merge all of them into a 'socket' validator.
@nodivbyzero @deankarn Kindly look into this.

issueDTO.title: feat: Bump the dependencies of wasmedge-ffmpeg, ffmpeg to 7.1 'P??ter' (LTS)
issueDTO.description:
### Summary

Previously, the wasmedge-ffmpeg plugin used ffmpeg 6.0, which is already EOL. It's not possible to ask our users to install a legacy version of ffmpeg, especially since it will require users to build from the source.

To fix this, we have to decide to use the latest LTS version, 7.1, which is in active maintenance mode.

I believe API changes will be between the current version, 6.0.0, and the new version (7.1.1). So, the current implementation of the wasmedge-ffmpeg plugin will also need to be modified.


### Details

The following action items should be finished:

- [ ] Update to the new ffmpeg version 7.1.1
- [ ] Modify the implementation of wasmedge-ffmpeg
- [ ] Ensure the CI passes for building and testing

### Appendix

_No response_
