issueDTO.title: [Feature]: support subscription to finalized blocks
issueDTO.description:
### Component

provider, pubsub

### Describe the feature you would like

It would be useful in many scenarios to support a subscription to finalized blocks from a beacon (light) client.

Possible solution: add extra trait like `BeaconApi` in `provider::ext` mod

### Additional context

_No response_
comments:
This can be a helper type stream type that subscribes to new blocks and fetches the Finalized block per new block.

this can be made smarter by comparing timestamps, monitoring epoch.
Can I give it a try? I???m not sure how to get started, but I???d love to learn :b

sure @Another-DevX 

you can take a look at the existing subscribe/watch block fns, and we'd need something similar that fetches new blocks and occasionaly fetches the next finalized block,
since epochs are time based we can also optimize this with EPOCH time

I have a couple of questions regarding the implementation.
I've noticed that the last finalized block doesn't increase sequentially, instead, blocks seem to be finalized in batches.
Because of this, I can't think of a continuous and optimal way to stream finalized blocks. Do you have any ideas?
Or maybe I misunderstood something.

> I have a couple of questions regarding the implementation. I've noticed that the last finalized block doesn't increase sequentially, instead, blocks seem to be finalized in batches. Because of this, I can't think of a continuous and optimal way to stream finalized blocks. Do you have any ideas? Or maybe I misunderstood something.

Yes, you???re totally right ??? Ethereum finalizes only the last block of each epoch (every 32 slots), so finalized blocks don???t increase one-by-one. That???s why streaming them continuously is a bit tricky.

Then I'll implement it like this:

I'll periodically call eth_getBlockByNumber("finalized") to detect when a new block has been finalized. If the finalized block number increases, I???ll fetch all blocks between the previous and the new finalized block using eth_getBlockByNumber(n, true) and store them. This way I ensure I only persist finalized data, without relying on a beacon node or dealing with potential reorgs.

What do you think @ecol-master?
I haven???t found any other feasible way to implement this behavior, and I haven???t seen any libraries that provide this capability either, so this might be a novel implementation.

issueDTO.title: [MJX] jax.lax.while_loop in solver.py prevents computation of backward gradients
issueDTO.description:
### The feature, motivation and pitch

## Problem
The solver's `jax.lax.while_loop` implementation prevents gradient computation through the environment step during gradient based trajectory optimization. This occurs in the [solver implementation](https://github.com/google-deepmind/mujoco/blob/300450f8b8441e5f00abc1105089a23f50d7147c/mjx/mujoco/mjx/_src/solver.py#L570) when iterations > 1.

Error encountered with `jax.jit` compiled grad function:
```
ValueError: Reverse-mode differentiation does not work for lax.while_loop or lax.fori_loop with dynamic start/stop values.
```

Current workaround of using `opt.iteration=1` leads to potentially inaccurate simulation and gradients.

## Proposed Solution
Add an option to set a fixed iteration count (e.g., 4) that would be compatible with reverse-mode differentiation using either `lax.scan` or `lax.fori_loop` with static bounds.

### Alternatives

_No response_

### Additional context

_No response_
comments:
I like this suggestion and have labeled it as a good one for someone to take on externally.  If no one does, we'll eventually implement it ourselves.

If someone would like to try it, I'd recommend briefly proposing (in this issue) how to modify the API to expose this functionality, and then if we all agree, then open a PR.
@erikfrey are you still looking for a volunteer to tackle this? I'd like to give it a shot.

Hi @erikfrey 

I previously did try to contribute to this project. But my PR is still pending(now can complete as I now have some better experience with a large codebase[LibreOffice])

### Problem understanding: 
**jax.lax.while_loop** in the solver prevents gradient computation during backpropagation, we need to replace the dynamic loop with a static one when a fixed iteration count is specified.

### Solution proposed:
All Im thinking of introducing a new boolean option in the Model.opt. based on that, the solver will use a static loop with a fixed number of iterations, enabling gradient computation.

Named something like - static_iterations


### Code modifications:

 **Check static_iterations Flag:** In the solver's solve function, we can use **_jax.lax.fori_loop_** instead of **_jax.lax.while_loop_** when _static_iterations_ is enabled.

**Run Fixed Iterations:** When _static_iterations_ is True, execute the solver loop exactly _m.opt.iterations_ times, bypassing the convergence checks.


Basically replacing **jax.lax.while_loop** with **jax.lax.scan** or with **jax.lax.fori_loop** when the flag is enabled?

I'm thinking of using **jax.lax.fori_loop**  seems more appropriate choice

In C MuJoCo there is a trivial way to fix the number of iterations: set `mjModel.opt.tolerance = 0`.

But I'll let @erikfrey comment on the correct way to do this in JAX

I tried to understand regarding setting **mjModel.opt.tolerance = 0**  i.e. this effectively disables the convergence check which means the solver will continue iterating until it reaches the maximum number of iterations specified, regardless of whether the solution has converged.

It might lead to slightly less accurate solutions because the solver may continue even after reaching a satisfactory solution.

But, In Jax we are using a while(dynamic) loop which stops when the tolerance criteria met and having a fixed number of iterations could provide a deterministic behavior just like C MuJoCo.
Hello! Can you please let me work on this?
Can I solve this issue?

I have used this method and this seems like a better candidate for this situation :)

https://github.com/google-deepmind/mujoco/blob/2c4fed07d2cd5470a1332cbaefcf3d5a176c8354/mjx/mujoco/mjx/_src/solver.py#L236-L237

summary.attemptedFixes: The author proposed introducing a new boolean option in the Model.opt to enable static iterations, and modifying the solver's solve function to use `jax.lax.fori_loop` instead of `jax.lax.while_loop` when static_iterations is enabled.

The proposed solution is to add an option to set a fixed iteration count using either `lax.scan` or `lax.fori_loop` with static bounds.

issueDTO.title: multiplexers are limited to 5 bit addresses (should be up to 6 bits)
issueDTO.description:
any blocks that are currently limited by bits, like multiplexers, that are limited to 5bits address should be full bits capable, like 64-bits or 32-bits, or at least 8-bits. (latest release version from august 2024).

edit: certain designs require very wide multiplexers to be simulated.

disregard this if bit selectors do the same thing as multiplexers but for any bits amount.
comments:
additional note: simulator should show the current component/line values by default, especially when with the clock tick step mode. not needing to select the hand show value tool specifically. but show all circuit values (assume say 1-bit or 8-bit values on the lines). component current values (not only line poke values) should be able to choose if its decimal instead of the default hex value.

also register component does not seem to be set to data line value when WE is 1 by clock input. data line 8-bit input value shows to be 1, but register output value is still 0 after tick.  edit: register R-line text is located too close to the clock input line, causes confusion. I thought the R-text referred to the left input, not to down input.

some edits to an existing circuit might cause some registers stop working, the output stored value not changing. sometimes the register starts with ?? value. resetting to 0 value with the pin sets it to 0, but the clock storing line does not activate value storage. restart and reload of the same circuit was required to get simulation working again.

Thanks for your feedback @goofyseeker311! However, you are mixing too many topics in this issue. Please keep each issue focused to a single aspect. You can specify relationships between issues to link them if needed. Therefore, I ask you to file new issues from your second comment so that they can be independently discussed.

Regarding the limited width of the select input of plexer components. The limitation to 5 bit wide selection inputs (choice among 32 inputs/outputs is for many practical situations sufficient. It was also in line with the maximum word width of 32 bits. The maximum bus width was increased to 64 bit some time ago. So, it may make sense to increase the width to 6 bits. The main reason for the current limitation to 5 bit is of a practical nature: The component symbol needs to scale with the number of inputs/outputs addressed via the select input. Too big symbols are hard to handle in schematic entry. Each new bit would double the size of the plexers. Therefore, an increase to 6 bit or 8 bit might be feasible, but not beyond that.

Anyway, such wide plexers would be typically used in memories and for these applications, we have dedicated RAM/ROM component models. The Bit Selector component might be also suitable in some cases, but is limited to a 64-bit-wide input. If you have a concrete needs, please describe them in more detail so that we can evaluate if your enhancement request is in line with the goal of this project.

PRs to address this and your other issues are welcome!

PS: Showing the values on all signals by default is less practical than one might think at first glance. Once circuits grow in complexity such additional elements on the screen become distracting. Additionally, the required additional paint operation would limit the simulator performance considerably.

PPS: The Write Enable (WE) input of data registers behaves consistently to its specification in the documentation and the expected behaviour of such components in reality. WE needs to be active before the active edge selected via the Trigger attribute. Only, when you choose the Trigger to be level-sensitive, you obtain latch behaviour, where WE is also evaluated during the active level of the enable input due to the transparent nature of latches in this mode.

PPPS: Finally, the problems you observe while doing edits during an active simulation: We fixed several issues in this area since the last official release. Please, check whether the problem persists in our [Nightly builds](https://github.com/logisim-evolution/logisim-evolution?tab=readme-ov-file#nightly-builds).

my design requires at least 8-bit mux (would equal 256 output lines, 32-bit and 64-bit might be a bit too large, unless you have a linear array type massive memory cell output). the value being next to the data line by default/option would make debugging more simple, for me at least.

all these are from my viewpoint, not from any other viewpoint. just reporting in usability and other issues at once. all other issues were "resolved" by getting to know how some non-intuitive choices of ui actually work. this issue deals with how components work in general.

edit: if logisim-evolution will not support up to 8-bit mux, then I might put two such things serially to add virtual 10-bit mux. ie 4-bit to 16x 4-bit muxes to get full 8-bit mux.

imo: not often used is an excuse for missing feature.

> my design requires at least 8-bit mux (would equal 256 output lines, 32-bit and 64-bit might be a bit too large, unless you have a linear array type massive memory cell output). 

It is not planned to extend the maximum bus width beyond 64 bit. It would have a too big impact on the implementation of Logisim's simulation engine and negative impact on simulation performance.

> the value being next to the data line by default/option would make debugging more simple, for me at least.

The `Wiring` library contains the `Probe` component, which you can connect to any signal, which value you want to keep an eye on. Its properties also allow you to configure the `Radix`, with which the value shall be displayed.

> all these are from my viewpoint, not from any other viewpoint. just reporting in usability and other issues at once. all other issues were "resolved" by getting to know how some non-intuitive choices of ui actually work. this issue deals with how components work in general.

We welcome any reports of usability issues. However, we ask you to keep each report focussed on a single issue. Only in this way, we can focus the discussion on a topic and keep track of each issue. 

> edit: if logisim-evolution will not support up to 8-bit mux, then I might put two such things serially to add virtual 10-bit mux. ie 4-bit to 16x 4-bit muxes to get full 8-bit mux.

As a workaround, you can create your 256-to-1 multiplexer from eight 32-to-1 multiplexers to which you connect the least 5 bits of your address. Their output, you can then connect to the inputs of a 8-to-1 multiplexer to which select input, you have to connect the remaining 3 most significant bits of your address.

> imo: not often used is an excuse for missing feature.

I will update the title of this issue to extend the select input to 64 bits. PRs to implement this enhancement are welcome.

It is easy to change the maximum size of the select pin for the plexers. I tried it with 6, 7, and 8. Of course, setting it to 8 results in a very large component with 256 inputs. I'll make a PR.

@maehne: Should it be set to 6, 7, or 8? There doesn't seem to be an efficiency concern with going bigger since it makes no difference unless a bigger value is selected. And then it takes longer to draw the image and has more hot spots in the circuit state, but it is actually less work in simulation and drawing than building it with several plexers, assuming it is really needed.

issueDTO.title: API: Ability to create secrets and variables in bulk
issueDTO.description:
## Description

The import functionality in the CLI and platform currently calls the API over and over again. This takes up a lot of bandwidth. Having an endpoint that supports bulk upload would fix this issue.

## Solution

We would like to have the following endpoints:
```http
POST /api/secret/:projectSlug/bulk
POST /api/variable/:projectSlug/bulk
```

The implementations would be in the `secret` and `variable` modules. 

The request body would be the same as `createSecret` and `createVariable`, just that it would accept array types. 

Reuse the functionality present for creating a secret and variable

issueDTO.title: feat: integration tests for java generator
issueDTO.description:
## feat: integration tests for java generator

### Description

The CLI has adopted an integration testing pattern to validate that generated feature flag clients compile and function correctly within their respective language ecosystems. The Java generator does not yet have integration test coverage.

We should implement integration tests for the Java generator using the standardized approach outlined in the test suite documentation.

📄 **Relevant Documentation:**  
[Integration Testing Pattern](https://github.com/open-feature/cli/blob/main/test/README.md)

---

### Tasks

- [ ] Create a test project scaffold for Java (e.g., using Maven or Gradle)
- [ ] Generate a feature flag client using the Java generator
- [ ] Compile and execute basic assertions (e.g., ensure the generated code builds, dependencies resolve, and a simple flag evaluation runs)
- [ ] Integrate this test into the broader test suite and CI workflow
- [ ] Add any Java-specific test setup or notes to the documentation if needed

---

### Acceptance Criteria

- ??? Java generator is covered by at least one integration test  
- ??? Generated Java code compiles and passes basic execution  
- ??? Integration test runs as part of the CI suite  
- ??? Test follows the documented integration testing structure

---

### Additional Notes

Adding Java integration tests ensures that changes to the generator do not silently introduce regressions and increases confidence in the CLI's language support matrix.
comments: @aepfli, Can I work on this issue? And can you give more info?

issueDTO.title: [FEATURE] Temperate graph
issueDTO.description:
I noticed there is a temperature graph at the sleep stage overview (4 week overview, see provided screenshot, the pink line). 

I think it would be handy to have a graph of this on the site, so we can follow our temperature as well, so we can maybe even see a minor temperature rise before we really get sick for example. 

I also know that there is an body temperature application available on the Garmin watches, so it seems that there is some temperature registration. 

Can you check if you could check the API for a temperature export and make a graph for it? 
It would be super handy (specially for people with chronic illnesses who have to track stuff like this).
comments:
Hello @gompstar 

Although the screenshot is not visible above, I know about this from the [official Garmin FAQ](https://support.garmin.com/en-US/?faq=RDXq6E5Iaq9rD1l1kTObf6)

This feature is limited on a few devices as listed there and `Vivoactive` is not compatible. So I personally cannot test or add this feature. But I agree this is a very important aspect, and would be useful if you have a compatible device. I may be able to implement this if I have a valid JSON example from the endpoint (it's not available via the python-garminconnect directly, but we can always make the request with `garmin_obj.connectapi(endpoint)` )

I am marking this as good first issue for other people to have a look. The goal is to figure out the endpoint for temperature tracking and writing a function to extract this and add it under the sleep measurement on influxDB so it can be visualized alongside.
If you could give me some hints how to do this, I can definitely give it a try to provide you all the info you need!

If you have a little python background, that should be possible. Check out [python-garminconnect](https://github.com/cyberjunky/python-garminconnect) project! Then you need to open the data browser, inspect the page and reload it to see the request endpoints for the temperature data page. Then you can try out that path with the python-garminconnect package, by using the connectapi() method.

issueDTO.title: Improve Align Camera View to Selected Reference (Face, Datum)
issueDTO.description:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing issues

### Problem description

What is missing (and is available in most CAD software) is to align the camera view to a selected reference in the 3D view, with a dedicated button in the core toolbar.

In the sketcher there is a button to align the 3D view to the plane of the sketch, so why not allow this as a core function in FreeCAD. It would be helpful in many WB, to make splits in Curves WB (always from the viewing angle), activate clipping planes, ...

There is a macro for this I have found in the Addon Manager "Align View to Face" https://wiki.freecadweb.org/Macro_Align_View_to_Face which works good for faces and datums but I have to install it on every machine and create a custom button for it. Would this be a start to merge this function and eventually update its features?

The align view to reference tool should align the camera to the previous selection:

- Faces and Datums > Normal view (like the macro does today)
- If the camera view already matches the selection, maybe reverse it to view from behind (- normal direction) or a button (even in dropdown menu of the new button) to reverse it.
- Allow the selection of edges, lines and axes and set their direction to the normal position of the camera view
- Allow the view to be aligned to current clipping planes
- Replace ViewSketch with the new tool and set it to the active sketch plane https://wiki.freecad.org/Sketcher_ViewSketch
- Maybe run a "FitSelection" command after setting the view rotation to get the whole selection in focus

---

- [x] One Face
- [x] One Line
- [x] Datums (axis/plane)
- [x] Origin objects (axis system and default planes for bodies and part objects)
- [x] If one line is a curve or circle and laying in one dimension / plane --> use this normal direction
- [ ] If the camera view already matches the selection, maybe reverse it to view from behind (- normal direction) or a button (even in dropdown menu of the new button) to reverse it.
- [ ] Multiple faces (average direction)
- [ ] Average normal of curved surfaces
- [ ] Multiple lines (if they lay on one common plane (always with selection of 2 straight lines), align to this plane's normal)
- [ ] Allow the view to be aligned to current clipping planes
- [ ] Replace ViewSketch with the new tool and set it to the active sketch plane https://wiki.freecad.org/Sketcher_ViewSketch









### Full version info

```shell
OS: Windows 11 build 22621
Word size of FreeCAD: 64-bit
Version: 0.22.0dev.34810 (Git)
Build type: Release
Branch: main
Hash: 196cbecde66a1c3a1b56b8c532ad1faedff4818b
Python 3.10.13, Qt 5.15.8, Coin 4.0.0, Vtk 9.2.5, OCC 7.6.3
Locale: German/Germany (de_DE)
Installed mods: 
  * 3DfindIT 1.2.0
  * 3D_Printing_Tools
  * BIM 2021.12.0
  * CfdOF 1.24.7
  * CurvedShapes 1.0.4
  * Curves 0.6.14
  * Defeaturing 1.2.1
  * fasteners 0.4.68
  * freecad.gears 1.0.0
  * freecad_metal_workbench 0.0.1
  * OpenDark 2023.10.30
  * sheetmetal 0.3.1
  * Silk 0.1.5
```



### Subproject(s) affected?

None

### Anything else?

https://wiki.freecadweb.org/Macro_Align_View_to_Face
https://forum.freecad.org/viewtopic.php?t=58695
https://forum.freecad.org/viewtopic.php?t=76717
https://wiki.freecad.org/Macro_Align_Face_Object_to_View

### Code of Conduct

- [X] I agree to follow this project's Code of Conduct
comments: @PaddleStroke you reworked already some toolbars for the better - what is your opinion on this?

I think you should split your issue in 2. Because its really 2 separate topics.
On the grouping of standard views, I think many people will disagree.

For the align to face tool, I think indeed that this is a missing feature that should be in core by default.
Note: If this tool is implemented, the sketcher tool could be removed as they would be redundant.
I think it would also be great, if the view direction (camera) can be aligned to a selected clipping plane (normal)

According to here https://forum.freecad.org/viewtopic.php?p=718524#p718524 it should be already be available in Realthunder's version. I can't tell if this correct - thus please double check by yourselfe.

@FreeCutter it is there but it does not work for me. Its sometimes the opposite and not working for edges or planes

https://github.com/realthunder/FreeCAD/commit/b6bd57a26effaaf3a3560a4656815080cc92f29f

https://github.com/realthunder/FreeCAD/blob/07c85fedeae51f76d1999f15b24d3c921f623f8d/src/Gui/CommandView.cpp#L1729
https://github.com/realthunder/FreeCAD/blob/07c85fedeae51f76d1999f15b24d3c921f623f8d/src/Gui/View3DInventorViewer.cpp#L4322

@Rexbas you have great experience with navigation controls, camera movement and animations: is this something you could get done for the v1.0 feature freeze in mid May? I can provide an icon for the command and add the command to the toolbar.

Would this also fix the janky camera jumps when trying to focus a sketch, or should I create a separate issue for that? It seems that the camera orientation doesn't always animate from where it is actually looking, but some arbitrary other orientation that I'm not sure where it comes from. Might not be worth fixing separately if it's gonna be replaced by a more universal solution.

@maxwxyz, I will try my best :) 

@jwueller, I think I know what you mean but I am not sure. Better make a new issue, preferably with video.
nice!!

I don't think this will be finished before mid may, I have trouble creating a Python script while doing https://wiki.freecad.org/Line_drawing_function#Testing_the_script. I get `ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'exercise'`

does it need to be in python?
any chance a stripped down version could be implemented, e.g. just faces?

this is a sometimes working version in RT 
https://github.com/realthunder/FreeCAD/commit/b6bd57a26effaaf3a3560a4656815080cc92f29f

https://github.com/realthunder/FreeCAD/blob/07c85fedeae51f76d1999f15b24d3c921f623f8d/src/Gui/CommandView.cpp#L1729
https://github.com/realthunder/FreeCAD/blob/07c85fedeae51f76d1999f15b24d3c921f623f8d/src/Gui/View3DInventorViewer.cpp#L4322

I managed to run a Python script by placing it in my build directory / Mod.

There is a `face.normalAt(...)` like used here: https://wiki.freecad.org/Macro_Align_View_to_Face. I am not aware of a `normalAt` method in C++ but if there is let me know.

I tried the code in RT but I could not get it to work. It always goes to the same orientation for a given body no matter which face is selected.

I see this feature request as two problems
1. Getting a (normal) vector from whatever the situation is (face selection, edge selection, sketch plane, ...)
2. Aligning the camera with the obtained vector using the smallest possible angle.

I think I can do point 2 relatively quickly as I have done something similar for the navigation cube. However, point 1 will take more time. I am still figuring out how to do this. I will continue working on this when I have time but probably won't be finished before feature freeze. Suggestions are welcome.

I'm no expert.
for 1. if selection is

- one line, edge or datum axis just use the direction / vector as input

issueDTO.title: Migrate away from tap in all repositories
issueDTO.description:
I think we __must__ move away from
tap in favor of node:test, as Isaacs has stated that he will drop unsupported Node.js version in patch releases. Given our infrequent major release cadence, it's not a good bet for us.

https://x.com/izs/status/1810339751456825767?s=46&t=22eoAstJVk5l46KQXYEk5Q
comments: 100% on board. Whatever my quibbles with `node:test` may be, the new position of `tap` is untenable.

Can we delay this work until `fastify@5` is released as latest?
Currently, most new PR is landed in `main` then back-ported to `4.x`. Such changes would break the automatic back-porting immediately.

For plugin, I think that should be fine. Most of them not frequently updated.
I think so!
Yes. Dev dependencies do not affect releases.
Hello! Sorry if this a dumb question. Regarding the issue does someone need to also rewrite all the test cases to use node:test?
The needed rewrite is usually trivial.

Hello @mcollina,

I'm working on this issue. While starting this task for the [pre-commit](https://github.com/fastify/pre-commit) repo, I realized we should first address the Node.js version support.

Given that Node.js 16 has reached its end of life, I propose the following steps before proceeding with the test framework migration:

1. Remove Node.js 16 from the CI configuration in `.github/workflows/ci.yml`.
   ```
   node-versions: '["18", "20", "22"]'
   ```
2. Update the `package.json` to reflect the new minimum supported Node.js version:
   ```json
   "engines": {
     "node": ">=18"
   }
   ```

This change aligns with the current LTS versions of Node.js and ensures we're not supporting EOL versions.

After making these changes, I'll proceed with the migration from tap to node:test.

What are your thoughts on this approach? 
Thank you for your guidance!
We are targeting v20+ for all the new releases of Fastify, go ahead with that in pre-commit too.

1. TypeScript Compatibility: The project tests are written in TypeScript, since node:test doesn???t support TypeScript by default, I???ve been exploring options. I???ve found that tsx and ts-node can run TypeScript tests without precompiling, which is helpful. I???m also looking into test loaders but still need to test this setup.
2. Test Reporting: Right now, the project uses tap-mocha-reporter, and I saw that node:test has a built-in JUnit reporter. I???m not sure how well it will work with TypeScript tests, so I may need to experiment to figure that out.
3. Considering borp: I found a test runner called borp, which works with TypeScript and uses node:test. It seems like a good option since it also handles coverage with c8 and provides reporting tools. I???m wondering if switching to it might make things easier overall.

I???d appreciate any thoughts you have on the best way to handle this, especially around TypeScript support and reporting.

Thanks!

issueDTO.title: eslint inconsistencies
issueDTO.description:
It seems that:

- we don't have a line length limit
- the [no-coma-dangle](https://eslint.org/docs/latest/rules/comma-dangle) rule is not forced, so we can have mixed situation where the trailing coma is there, and where it is not: [example](https://github.com/fastify/fastify/pull/5768#discussion_r2018451854_)

We need to assess and review a bit our new neostandard linter.
comments: I don't understand. What is happening?

It seems that:

- we don't have a line length limit
- the [no-coma-dangle](https://eslint.org/docs/latest/rules/comma-dangle) rule is not forced, so we can have mixed situation where the trailing coma is there, and where it is not

Regarding comma-dangle:
https://github.com/fastify/fastify-autoload/pull/442#issuecomment-2620977497

Thanks for pointing out.

We should force one or another - both are confusing 🫤
Historically, we had the `no-coma-dangle` rule, so I would stick with that

I also think that the configuration is too permissive, it's often impossible to go back when I accidentally launch prettier.
The issue is the same for plugins.

issueDTO.title: API `transform_poi()`: Internal Server Error when location without `best_public_translation`
issueDTO.description:
### Describe the Bug
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the bug is. -->
When we generate the api response for events, we deliver the title of the associated location in the default language for the region. We don't account for the case when that translation does not exist for some reason, so instead of gracefully sending a response without the title or with a placeholder, instead the request is aborted with status code 500, not delivering any useful information.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Go to https://cms-test.integreat-app.de/api/v3/maintal/de/events/?combine_recurring=True
2. See error

### Expected Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->
Graceful failure: Even if we cannot deliver the title of the location in the regions default language, we should deliver everything else of the response. The location title could fall back to a non-truthy value like `null`, be an empty string or a placeholder value

### Actual Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what actually happened. -->
The whole request *(in this case about multiple upcoming events)* is aborted with an *Internal Server Error*

### Additional Information
<!-- Add any other context (e.g. logs, etc.) about the problem here. -->

<details>
  <summary>Traceback</summary>

```
Jul 06 09:00:24 ERROR   django.request - 500 Internal Server Error: /api/v3/maintal/de/events/?combine_recurring=True
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/opt/integreat-cms/.venv/lib/python3.11/site-packages/django/core/handlers/exception.py", line 55, in inner
    response = get_response(request)
               ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  File "/opt/integreat-cms/.venv/lib/python3.11/site-packages/django/core/handlers/base.py", line 197, in _get_response
    response = wrapped_callback(request, *callback_args, **callback_kwargs)
               ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  File "/opt/integreat-cms/.venv/lib/python3.11/site-packages/integreat_cms/api/decorators.py", line 125, in wrap
    return function(request, *args, **kwargs)
           ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  File "/opt/integreat-cms/.venv/lib/python3.11/site-packages/integreat_cms/api/v3/events.py", line 225, in events
    transform_event_translation(event_translation, poi_translation),
    ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  File "/opt/integreat-cms/.venv/lib/python3.11/site-packages/integreat_cms/api/v3/events.py", line 99, in transform_event_translation
    "location": transform_poi(event.location),
                ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  File "/opt/integreat-cms/.venv/lib/python3.11/site-packages/integreat_cms/api/v3/locations.py", line 52, in transform_poi
    "name": poi.default_public_translation.title,
            ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'title'
```

</details>

### Related Issues
<!-- A collection of all issues that are related to this issue and could be useful. -->
<!-- Please also include the related integreat-app issues, if possible. -->



### Summary of discussion and updates to the description
<!-- Summarize the discussion if a long conversation was made that changed something. E.g. -->
<!-- - <TIMESTAMP>: added stack trace from cms-test -->
<!-- Leave this section blank during the initial issue creation. -->

repository.description: Simplified content management back end for the Integreat App - a multilingual information platform for newcomers
repository.name: integreat-cms

summary.main: The main goal of the issue is to fix the Internal Server Error when generating the API response for events and the location does not have a `best_public_translation`.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The requirement is to deliver a response without the title or with a placeholder when the translation does not exist, instead of aborting the request with a 500 status code.
summary.attemptedFixes: The error is caused by an `AttributeError` when trying to access the `title` attribute of a `None` object in the `transform_poi()` method.
summary.otherNotes: The issue is related to the API `transform_poi()` method, which returns an Internal Server Error when the location does not have a `best_public_translation`. The error occurs because the code attempts to access the `title` attribute of a `None` object.

summary.main: Fix the bug that prevents waves from being started from the lobby.

summary.main: The main goal is to create a pseudonym for the player in the game engine, initializing it based on the user's TG and then changing it independently.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The name should be unique, on Latin and Cyrillic letters with a limited set of characters (-, _, ', " )
summary.attemptedFixes: The solution requires adding a new field 'name' to the 'players' table, generating migrations, updating the model, and adding the 'name' field to 'dto.Player'.
summary.otherNotes: The issue is related to displaying player names in the team or wavers, which may be similar or difficult to distinguish. The solution is to add a new field 'name' to the 'players' table with a priority to use it. If it's not set, use the name from TG. The model should be updated, migrations should be generated, and the 'name' field should be added to 'dto.Player'. The '@property' 'name_mention' should use 'self.name' prioritarily.

issueDTO.title: Broadcast follow fide player and tournaments
issueDTO.description:
- Add a toggle on broadcast player screen to follow a fide player
  - To follow or unfollow a fide player use: POST  /fide/:fideId/follow?follow=(true|false)
  - To know if a fide player is followed, a field `isFollowing` is present in the json of GET   /broadcast/:tourId/players/:fideId. If not present the user is not logged in or the player is not a fide player.

- Add a toggle on broadcast round screen to follow a tournament
  - To follow or unfollow a tournament use: POST  /broadcast/:tourId/subscribe?set=(true|false)
  - To know if a fide player is followed, a field `isSubscribed` is present in the json of GET   /api/broadcast/:ts/:rs/:roundId

issueDTO.title: Adding more functionality to DecisionBoundaryDisplay
issueDTO.description:
This issue is to track the improvements that should be made to the `DecisionBoundaryDisplay`:

- [x] handle multiclass classification
    - [x] target a specific class: https://github.com/scikit-learn/scikit-learn/pull/27291
    - [x] represent the max of probability
- [ ] allow to plot the decision boundary using a keyword without the need to call `DecisionBoundaryDisplay` twice
- [ ] Allow to pass `xlim/ylim` to overwrite the limit of the data seen in `from_estimator`.
comments:
I have used `DecisionBoundaryDisplay` to plot `from_estimator` of a `DecisionTreeClassifier` as [in this example](https://glemaitre.github.io/traces-sklearn/content/notebooks/06_tree_model.html).

Based on that I would suggest further improvements:
1. add a title to the plot that clearly states which `response_method` from which estimator was used in the plot
2. add a legend that shows the values (or value regions) of the response method used (percentages for `predict_proba`, classes for `proba`, raw values for `decision_function`)
   - 2b. redefine the representation of the legend that defines the classes, since they look like a scale rather than marking membership

Do you think this would be useful, @glemaitre?

I agree that we can improve the plot. Maybe some of those improvement would be opt-in via parameter. I need to think more about each of them but having proof of concept will help anyway to know if we want it a certain way.
/take

issueDTO.title: Temp data (170 GB) not cleaned up
issueDTO.description:
Checking my temp folder I noticed lots of files of around 150 MB in size like: 
C:\Users\Mike Wiegand\AppData\Local\Temp\terraform-provider7994040

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/7d028fa4-b4cd-45fb-8002-045ef76a5a11)

They total up to more than 170 GB.
comments: Hello and thank you for this issue! The core team regularly reviews new issues and discusses them, but this can take a little time. Please bear with us while we get to your issue. If you're interested, the contribution guide has a section about the [decision-making process](https://github.com/opentofu/opentofu/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#who-decides-if-a-feature-will-be-implemented-and-how-is-that-decision-made).

Thanks for reporting this, @mikeg-de!

These appear to be the temporary locations where OpenTofu downloads a provider package archive before extracting it into the provider cache directory.

There _is_ some code that makes a best-effort to clean these up:

https://github.com/opentofu/opentofu/blob/f8d128491c43e7b246d9de8538e21b383722beba/internal/getproviders/package_location_http_archive.go#L82-L87

However, I notice you are using Windows and so I suspect that what you've observed might be caused by Windows preventing the file from being deleted while it's still open, whereas that is allowed on other platforms that OpenTofu supports.

Due to how `defer` works in Go, these `defer` calls will be visited in _reverse order_ when the function exits, which means that OpenTofu is effectively calling `os.Remove` before it calls `os.Close`. Inverting these so that the `os.Close` call happens before the `os.Remove` call might be sufficient to make this work on Windows, if my theory is correct.

There's some similar treatment in the newly-added `PackageOCIBlobArchive` which seems like it'll have the same problem but for a slightly different reason:

https://github.com/opentofu/opentofu/blob/f8d128491c43e7b246d9de8538e21b383722beba/internal/getproviders/package_location_oci_blob_archive.go#L138-L142

In this case there is _only_ a call to `os.Remove`, and the function is relying on the automatic cleanup that closes the underlying filehandle when an `os.File` object goes out of scope, which would therefore _also_ cause these steps to happen in the wrong order. If I was correct about the cause of the problem in `PackageHTTPURL` then we should update `PackageOCIBlobArchive` to follow the same pattern.

In the meantime: OpenTofu does not rely on these files after provider installation is complete, so you can manually delete them immediately if you need to reclaim that disk space.
We are also skipping checking the return values of both of those functions, which is not ideal.  We should at least be logging the error to help diagnose issues like this one.
can I work on this?

Sure!  Thanks @KrishnaSindhur!

Please take a look through the [Contributing Guide](https://github.com/opentofu/opentofu/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md) before getting started.

Hi,

It seems this issue has been inactive for a few weeks.
Would it be okay if I go ahead and work on it, or is someone already actively handling it?

Thanks in advance!

issueDTO.title: Upgrade deprecated packages
issueDTO.description:
While updating the bundles this morning there is a lot of deprecated packages that we have in the core/build tool. I think we should seriously look at upgrading all of them to prevent security and other issues in the future.

Here is the output:
```
npm warn deprecated @npmcli/move-file@1.1.2: This functionality has been moved to @npmcli/fs
npm warn deprecated sourcemap-codec@1.4.8: Please use @jridgewell/sourcemap-codec instead
npm warn deprecated har-validator@5.1.5: this library is no longer supported
npm warn deprecated are-we-there-yet@2.0.0: This package is no longer supported.
npm warn deprecated gauge@3.0.2: This package is no longer supported.
npm warn deprecated inflight@1.0.6: This module is not supported, and leaks memory. Do not use it. Check out lru-cache if you want a good and tested way to coalesce async requests by a key value, which is much more comprehensive and powerful.
npm warn deprecated @babel/plugin-proposal-logical-assignment-operators@7.20.7: This proposal has been merged to the ECMAScript standard and thus this plugin is no longer maintained. Please use @babel/plugin-transform-logical-assignment-operators instead.
npm warn deprecated @babel/plugin-proposal-async-generator-functions@7.20.7: This proposal has been merged to the ECMAScript standard and thus this plugin is no longer maintained. Please use @babel/plugin-transform-async-generator-functions instead.
npm warn deprecated @babel/plugin-proposal-nullish-coalescing-operator@7.18.6: This proposal has been merged to the ECMAScript standard and thus this plugin is no longer maintained. Please use @babel/plugin-transform-nullish-coalescing-operator instead.
npm warn deprecated @babel/plugin-proposal-optional-chaining@7.21.0: This proposal has been merged to the ECMAScript standard and thus this plugin is no longer maintained. Please use @babel/plugin-transform-optional-chaining instead.
npm warn deprecated @babel/plugin-proposal-object-rest-spread@7.20.7: This proposal has been merged to the ECMAScript standard and thus this plugin is no longer maintained. Please use @babel/plugin-transform-object-rest-spread instead.
npm warn deprecated @babel/plugin-proposal-optional-catch-binding@7.18.6: This proposal has been merged to the ECMAScript standard and thus this plugin is no longer maintained. Please use @babel/plugin-transform-optional-catch-binding instead.
npm warn deprecated @babel/plugin-proposal-class-properties@7.18.6: This proposal has been merged to the ECMAScript standard and thus this plugin is no longer maintained. Please use @babel/plugin-transform-class-properties instead.
npm warn deprecated npmlog@5.0.1: This package is no longer supported.
npm warn deprecated uuid@3.4.0: Please upgrade  to version 7 or higher.  Older versions may use Math.random() in certain circumstances, which is known to be problematic.  See https://v8.dev/blog/math-random for details.
npm warn deprecated rimraf@2.6.2: Rimraf versions prior to v4 are no longer supported
npm warn deprecated core-js@2.6.12: core-js@<3.23.3 is no longer maintained and not recommended for usage due to the number of issues. Because of the V8 engine whims, feature detection in old core-js versions could cause a slowdown up to 100x even if nothing is polyfilled. Some versions have web compatibility issues. Please, upgrade your dependencies to the actual version of core-js.
npm warn deprecated rimraf@3.0.2: Rimraf versions prior to v4 are no longer supported
npm warn deprecated glob@7.1.6: Glob versions prior to v9 are no longer supported
npm warn deprecated request@2.88.2: request has been deprecated, see https://github.com/request/request/issues/3142
npm warn deprecated are-we-there-yet@3.0.1: This package is no longer supported.
npm warn deprecated gauge@4.0.4: This package is no longer supported.
npm warn deprecated npmlog@6.0.2: This package is no longer supported.
npm warn deprecated rimraf@3.0.2: Rimraf versions prior to v4 are no longer supported
npm warn deprecated rimraf@3.0.2: Rimraf versions prior to v4 are no longer supported
```

From a quick look the tasks are:
- [ ] `@npmcli/move-file` should be replaced with `@npmcli/fs`
- [ ] `sourcemap-codec` should be replaced with `@jridgewell/sourcemap-codec`
- [ ] Need replacement for `har-validator`
- [ ] Need replacement for `are-we-there-yet`
- [ ] Need replacement for `gauge`
- [ ] `inflight` needs to be replaced with `lru-cache` or something similar
- [ ] `@babel/plugin-proposal-logical-assignment-operators` should no longer be needed
- [ ] `@babel/plugin-proposal-async-generator-functions` should no longer be needed
- [ ] `@babel/plugin-proposal-nullish-coalescing-operator` should no longer be needed
- [ ] `@babel/plugin-proposal-optional-chaining` should no longer be needed
- [ ] `@babel/plugin-proposal-object-rest-spread` should no longer be needed
- [ ] `@babel/plugin-proposal-optional-catch-binding` should no longer be needed
- [ ] `@babel/plugin-proposal-class-properties` should no longer be needed
- [ ] Find replacement for `npmlog`
- [ ] Upgrade `uuid` to at least v7
- [ ] Upgrade `rimraf` to at least v4
- [ ] Upgrade `core-js` to at least v3.23.3 - @nachocodoner this could potentially have some speed improvements
- [ ] Upgrade `glob` to at least v9
- [ ] Remove/replace `request` - https://github.com/request/request/issues/3142
comments:
This list is helpful, and it's good to catch pending updates in the tool. It can guide anyone ready to contribute and manage the delivery process with our support. For Babel upgrades, [refer to this comment](https://github.com/meteor/meteor/pull/13802#issuecomment-2996187240). They are difficult to handle and need extensive verification from us. Some of the others may need work but are easier for us to verify, I believe.

As a side note, here???s why we avoid frequent dependency upgrades. Upgrading is more than bumping version numbers: minor or major updates can introduce breaking changes and silent errors that are not covered by our tests. Our tests may catch some issues but miss others, leaving problems for future releases. Larger version jumps increase risk. We've seen this in past upgrades. Dependency updates are routine maintenance, which we've done a lot in recent years. Since we???re now focused on modernization and new features, I prefer to avoid introducing new issues unless they cause proven harm or come via contributions. We can handle quick fixes, but using core team capacity for routine updates would delay the long-requested features that Meteor desperately needs.

On security, I'm not concerned about dev-tools upgrades. Runtime dependencies for Meteor apps pose the real risk, so Meteor package patches should come first. Dev-tool vulnerabilities rarely affect development machines. I???d rather keep the Meteor tool stable as we modernize than chase time-consuming updates with no visible benefit. [I updated some in a separate branch](https://github.com/meteor/meteor/compare/devel...DEBT-update-tools-dependencies) to check performance with `meteor profile`, but saw no benefit and prefered to avoid any side-effect for this moment.

After we complete Meteor???s [next major and most exciting roadmap milestones](https://docs.meteor.com/about/roadmap), which are our current focus, we can dedicate more effort to this kind of maintenance ourselves. I???ll discuss this with the team. We may add a dev-tool maintenance item to the roadmap.

That said, I encourage contributors to work on these upgrades in separate PRs, referring to the relevant upgrade changelogs and ensuring full migration and delivery, including addresing reviews, test coverage, and other guidence. We can support them and, based on each change set???s criticality, map out the steps needed for complete verification to be candidate for next releases.
can i work on this issue if you want someone to do this

issueDTO.title: Incorrect differentiation result when using `std::pair`
comments: Hey, I would like to pick this up!

@gsreeja11 Please feel free to open a pull request for this issue.

@Hammadh7 I don't see how this solution would work.
@parth-07 I have defined type for pair type datatype in the differentiator.h file , but I will test it as well
@a-elrawy, can you look into this issue?

The old limitation was that the pullback of the constructor ``std::pair<double, double> p(u,v);`` was not generated. Now, it's generated but is incorrect because ``std::forward`` inside isn't differentiated. To fix the issue, we could either fix ``std::forward`` or add a custom derivative for the constructor.

repository.description: clad -- automatic differentiation for C/C++
repository.name: clad

summary.main: The main goal of this issue is to fix the incorrect differentiation result when using `std::pair` in the `clad` library.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The issue requires a fix in the `Differentiator.h` file to correctly generate the pullback of the constructor `std::pair<double, double> p(u,v);`.
summary.attemptedFixes: A solution was proposed to add support for pair tracking in `Differentiator.h` file by adding a template specialization for `std::pair`. A PR was also suggested. However, there was a discussion about the feasibility of this solution and it was pointed out that the problem is more complex and requires fixing `std::forward` or adding a custom derivative for the constructor.
summary.otherNotes: The issue is related to incorrect differentiation result when using `std::pair`. The expected output is `du: 1` and `dv: 1`, but the actual output is `du: 0` and `dv: 0`. The problem is in the `Differentiator.h` file and it seems that the pullback of the constructor `std::pair<double, double> p(u,v);` is not generated correctly.

issueDTO.title: Correct behaviour of Copy-Constructors
issueDTO.description:
Follow-Up to #893 

## Description

Copy-Constructors are supposed to create a copy of a given value - by value, not reference.
This is done by constructing a new value for the constructors type by _copying_ all fields from the old value to the one to be constructed.

Throughout the code-base this is currently flawed:
- Some Copy-Constructors miss required fields
- Some Copy-Constructors copy by reference, not value

## Definition of Done

- [ ] Checked for all occurences of Copy-Constructors
- [ ] Adjusted all Copy-Constructors such that **all** _required_ fields (no persistence-ids e.g.) are copied by value
comments:
Hi! I'd like to help with this issue.
I???ve read through the original issue #893 and understand that the goal is to ensure that copy constructors (e.g., in classes like TaskCommentImpl, ObjectReferenceImpl, etc.) copy all relevant fields by value and not reference ??? and omit persistence-related IDs where needed.

Would it be okay if I take on this task? I???ll start by reviewing all *Impl entity classes and correcting the constructors where necessary.

> Would it be okay if I take on this task? I???ll start by reviewing all *Impl entity classes and correcting the constructors where necessary.

Hey Omar! Certainly, go ahead :)
I am looking forward to reviewing your Pull-Request!

Hi!

I'm currently working on the issue, and I came across a situation that could use your input.

In some classes like `TaskSummaryImpl`, fields such as `classificationSummary`, `workbasketSummary`, `primaryObjRef`, and the list of `attachmentSummaries` are currently being copied by reference inside the copy constructor.

While reviewing this, I attempted to improve those constructors by using the `copy()` method provided by these fields. However, I noticed that the `copy()` methods intentionally omit persistence-related fields such as `id` and `taskId`. This behavior is now causing some tests (e.g., `TaskModelsCloneTest.testCloneInTaskSummary`) to fail, since the copied objects no longer retain those values.

I???d like to confirm what direction to take moving forward. Here are a few possible approaches:

* Option 1: Use a new `copyWithIds()` method (or similar)
Instead of modifying `copy()`, introduce a method like `copyWithIds()` to explicitly include identifiers like `id` and `taskId` when needed (e.g., in UI or test layers).

* Option 2: Modify the tests (they may be assuming too much)
If the design of `copy()` intentionally excludes persistence fields, perhaps the tests should be updated to reflect that ??? e.g., not asserting equality on `id` or `taskId` for copied objects.

* Option 3: Keep the current copy-by-reference behavior
If copying by reference is acceptable for now (even if not ideal), we could leave the copy constructors as they are to avoid breaking tests or logic relying on shared object identity.

Let me know which approach you'd prefer before I proceed with any changes.
Thanks in advance!

Great finding Omar, I love the outlining of the options!

We will go with Option 3 and keep the by-reference behavior for all related attribute-entities. Non-Entity attributes like those of type `Instant` should still be copied by-value.

(Actually quite interesting philosophically: If you as a father had children and I copied you, who'd be the father of them children? Or do I also need to copy the children?)

repository.description: Lightweight library for general purpose task management
repository.name: kadai

summary.main: The main goal of this issue is to correct the behavior of copy constructors in the codebase, ensuring they create a copy of a given value by value, not reference, and omit persistence-related IDs where necessary.
summary.validationOrRequirement: Copy constructors must create a copy of a given value by value, not reference. Required fields must be copied by value, and persistence-related IDs should be omitted where necessary.
summary.attemptedFixes: The issue is currently being worked on, and a few options have been presented: using a new copyWithIds() method, modifying the tests, or keeping the current copy-by-reference behavior. Option 3 has been chosen to keep the by-reference behavior for all related attribute-entities, except for non-Entity attributes like Instant which should still be copied by-value.
summary.otherNotes: This issue is a follow-up to #893, aiming to ensure copy constructors create a copy of a given value by value, not reference. The current codebase has flawed copy constructors that miss required fields or copy by reference.

issueDTO.title: [MCP] Checkout.com
issueDTO.description:
## 🧩 Product Overview  

Checkout.com is a global payments platform enabling powerful automation around transactions, payouts, customers, and hosted payment links.

---

## ?????? Important Note for Contributors  

To ensure consistency and maintainability, this feature must be submitted as a [Piece](https://www.activepieces.com/docs/developers/building-pieces/piece-definition) following the Activepieces architecture. Submissions that do not follow this format will not be accepted. Please make sure to review the [Piece Development Guidelines](https://www.activepieces.com/docs/developers/building-pieces/overview) before starting development.

---

## 🚨 Triggers  

| **Trigger** | **Use Case** |
|:--------------------------|:---------------------------------------|
| **Payment Events** | Trigger order fulfillment when payment is approved.|
|**Dispute Events**|Notify operations upon dispute opening or resolution.|

---

## 🛠??? Write Actions  

| **Action Item**               | **Use Case** |
|:--------------------------|:---------------------------------------|
| **Create Customer** | Store new vault customer with email/name/phone/metadata.|
| **Update Customer** |  Update existing customer or their metadata.|
|**Create Payment Link**|Send payment link via email or SMS to a client.|
|**Create Payout**| Transfer merchant earnings.|
|**Refund a Payment**|Issue a refund (full or partial) for a captured payment.|

issueDTO.title: Inconsistent Field Naming Between `outputSchema` and `model_dump`
issueDTO.description:
If the model to return by a tool is defined like:

```python
class Foo(BaseModel):
    field_first: str | None = Field(
        default=None, alias="first", description="The first field."
    )
    field_second: str | None = Field(
        default=None, alias="second", description="The second field."
    )
```

In `outputSchema` of `tools/list` they will be displayed as "first" and "second".

At the same time `model_dump` in
https://github.com/modelcontextprotocol/python-sdk/blob/6f43d1f17022d9d45b51955304e39ad43ca48014/src/mcp/server/fastmcp/utilities/func_metadata.py#L114
will produce the dump with "field_first" and "field_second".

To keep the schema and the tool response consistent, consider adding `by_alias=True` to the call of `model_dump`.

repository.description: The official Python SDK for Model Context Protocol servers and clients
repository.name: python-sdk

summary.main: To keep the schema and the tool response consistent, consider adding `by_alias=True` to the call of `model_dump`.
summary.validationOrRequirement: Adding `by_alias=True` to the call of `model_dump` to keep the schema and the tool response consistent.
summary.otherNotes: The issue is related to inconsistent field naming between `outputSchema` and `model_dump` in the modelcontextprotocol/python-sdk repository.

issueDTO.title: Feature Request: Enable Voice Notes
issueDTO.description:
### **Feature Request: Enable Voice Notes**  

**Description:**  
Implement a feature that allows users to record and send voice messages within the chat.  

**Expected Behavior:**  
- Users can record audio directly from the chat interface.  
- The audio is sent and stored on the server.  
- Recipients can play the voice message within the chat window.  

**Tech Stack:**  
- HTML5 Web Audio API (Recording)  
- Django (File Handling & Storage)  
- JavaScript (Frontend Integration)
comments: Hi @frzn23, Could you  assign this to me? I may not be quick in landing this, but I'll aim to submit a PR within a week.
yes sure @Iamkaranja

1. **Clarification on Requirements:**
   - Could you provide more details on the expected UI for recording and sending voice notes?
     - Specifically, the user flow from starting a recording to sending it, and error handling for permissions issues, failed uploads, or unsupported browsers.
   - What audio formats will be supported (e.g., MP3, WAV), considering compatibility with different browsers and devices?
   - What is the maximum duration for voice messages to manage server storage and playback performance?
     - For example, limit voice messages to 60 seconds.

2. **Technical Specifications:**
   - Are there any specific libraries or dependencies you would recommend for implementing the HTML5 Web Audio API?
   - Could you clarify the server-side requirements for storing audio files in Django?
     - For now, local storage is fine, but we should consider cloud storage services like AWS S3 and others.

@frzn23  Lmk what you think.

@Iamkaranja 
**expected UI for recording and sending voice notes?**
As we do not have an app right now we cannot use touch gestures as much.
let's say there is a voice not button, the user presses it, it transforms the text box into voice note recording animation, there shall be a cancel button and a send button with respective functions attached to them.

**What audio formats will be supported**
after doing some research on which audio format takes the least space, we should go for .OPUS

**let's limit voice messages to 60 seconds for now.**

**Technical Specifications**
Let's use MediaRecorder API, it lets you record audio and/or video from a user's device, usually by capturing input from the microphone or webcam.
It records in webM format with OPUS encoding, that seems efficient for our workplan.

**server-side requirements for storing audio files**
let's keep it in local storage for now as default, when we move towards the hosting phase, we will transition a lot of things according to production.

Let me know if you need help with anything.
(try to create a separate a Django project to get used to the API and the upload process)
Hi @frzn23, thank you for your guidance. I'll get started with these in mind.
hello @Iamkaranja . I was wondering if there is any update on the issue?

> hello @Iamkaranja . I was wondering if there is any update on the issue?

Hey! Sorry, I got caught up with other stuff and haven???t had a chance to finish this yet. I???ll try to get back to it soon.

issueDTO.title: [Bug]: Email verification input text field should not be multiline on login screen
issueDTO.description:
### Summary

At the login screen, sometimes we need to enter a verification code received by email, likely when we sign up on a new device. This email verification input field appears after providing the correct username and password. 

### Steps to reproduce

1. Freshly install the Commons App
2. Open the app and try to log in with your username and password

Android 14

Main Branch

_No response_

issueDTO.title: SHOW TABLES should list results alphabetically by default
issueDTO.description:
In the current version, `SHOW TABLES` does not return the result in a sorted manner. Adding `ORDER BY tableName` does not help. Most DBs sort the output of `SHOW TABLES` alphabetically by default, I think it would make sense if we did the same.

__Note:__ This is not a UI-only change regarding results in the Web Console, but requires changes in how the SQL is executed in the backend.
comments: I would like to work on this issue, is that ok? Can you point me in the correct direction as to where this should be worked on? I am unsure of the correct file location. Any further information is greatly appreciated!

hello @jttmtv, this looks like a good entry point: https://github.com/questdb/questdb/blob/8442ddb97dc0be09e29dea40892ffdadc8b2705d/core/src/main/java/io/questdb/griffin/SqlCompiler.java#L2575

it seems the magic is happening here: https://github.com/questdb/questdb/blob/6eca37b8f27bb1d51efc6cd8e68199ef2bd57b82/core/src/main/java/io/questdb/griffin/engine/table/TableListRecordCursorFactory.java#L97-L110

and last but not least: The `ShowTablesTest` will help you to get something up and running quickly. 

It seems to be the current mechanism is just iterating over directories as a directory means a table. 
It ultimately calls native functions to access implemented in C, but judging from your GH profile it shouldn't be a problem for you.
fwiw: this is a possible workaround `select * from all_tables order by table;` or simply `all_tables order by table;`
I would like to work on this issue.
Has this issue been resolved? When querying `show tables`, I got all the tables in ascending order. I also ran the test @jttmtv crafted in #353 and got a passing test.
@stephenspol I don't think this one is resolved. Could be a coincidence that you're getting records in-order.

I was testing this and it seems like the feature has been implemented in the current master branch (6.5.3), however it was not implemented in whatever version the live demo on the website is using. It's notable that in the table preview in the top left the tables are listed alphabetically in two groups: those that start with capitals and those that start with lowercase, however `SHOW TABLES` works as expected. It definitely doesn't seem coincidental given that I was able to reproduce it a lot.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/46794728/191025440-f580e0e1-3c27-483c-8946-c49b324043b7.png)
Hi @mpsq , can I comtribute in this please ?
Can I contribute in this one ?
@Somya2010 sure thing. Thanks for willing to contribute!

> In the current version, `SHOW TABLES` does not return the result in a sorted manner. Adding `ORDER BY tableName` does not help. Most DBs sort the output of `SHOW TABLES` alphabetically by default, I think it would make sense if we did the same.
> 
> **Note:** This is not a UI-only change regarding results in the Web Console, but requires changes in how the SQL is executed in the backend.

Parses SHOW TABLES

SELECT table_name FROM information_schema.tables 
WHERE table_schema = 'public'
ORDER BY table_name;

  Implementation Suggestion 

def handle_show_tables(schema: str = 'public'):
    sql = f"""
        SELECT table_name 
        FROM information_schema.tables 
        WHERE table_schema = '{schema}' 
        ORDER BY table_name
    """
    return execute_sql(sql)

issueDTO.title: Replace custom backoff with https://github.com/litl/backoff
issueDTO.description:
Remove our homemade `ExponentialBackoff` (in `helpers.py`) and switch to the proven [litl/backoff](https://github.com/litl/backoff) library. This will simplify retry logic, reduce maintenance, and leverage built-in features (jitter, logging hooks).

---

## Changes

1. **Add Dependency**

   * Add `backoff>=2.0.1` to `pyproject.toml`.

2. **Delete `ExponentialBackoff`**

   * Remove its class definition from `helpers.py`.

3. **Refactor `buffers.py`**

   * Remove `retry_backoff` and `shutdown_backoff` fields.
   * Create a private method (e.g. `_flush_once`) for a single callback attempt.
   * Decorate(?) `flush` with:

     ```python
     @backoff.on_exception(
         backoff.expo, Exception,
         max_time=10,
         on_backoff=lambda details: await asyncio.sleep(details["wait"])
     )
     async def flush(self):
         ???  # call _flush_once or re-enqueue on final failure
     ```
   * Decorate(?) `shutdown_and_flush` similarly, stopping early if the queue is empty.

4. **Update Tests**

   * Replace any expectations around manual `next_delay()`/`reset()` with assertions for the `backoff` retry behavior.
   * Ensure `flush` stops retrying once the callback succeeds.
   * Verify shutdown halts when the buffer is empty or max time is reached.

5. **Documentation**

   * Remove references to ???custom backoff.???
   * Note how to adjust `backoff.expo` parameters (base/jitter/max\_time) if needed.

---

## Checklist

* [ ] Add `backoff` to dependencies
* [ ] Delete `ExponentialBackoff` from `helpers.py`
* [ ] Refactor `buffers.py` to use `@backoff.on_exception`
* [ ] Update/remove imports of `ExponentialBackoff`
* [ ] Revise tests to target `litl/backoff` behavior
* [ ] Update documentation to mention `litl/backoff`

issueDTO.title: feat: `exponentialBackoff` field
issueDTO.description:
Currently, `repeatPolicy` only supports fixed intervals between retries. This doesn't handle scenarios where services need progressively longer recovery times.

### Design
Add an `exponentialBackoff` boolean field to enable exponential backoff behavior:

```yaml
steps:
  - name: check-service
    command: curl -f https://api.example.com/health
    repeatPolicy:
      intervalSec: 1          # Initial interval
      limit: 5                # Max attempts
      exponentialBackoff: true  # Enable exponential backoff
      exitCode: [1]           # Repeat on failure
```

**Behavior:**
- 1st retry: 1s
- 2nd retry: 2s  
- 3rd retry: 4s
- 4th retry: 8s
- 5th retry: 16s

### Implementation
1. Add `ExponentialBackoff bool` to `RepeatPolicy` struct in `/internal/digraph/step.go`
2. Update scheduler logic in `/internal/digraph/scheduler/scheduler.go:334` to calculate interval as: `interval * (2^retryCount)`
3. Use existing `node.State().DoneCount` to track retry attempts
comments: @yottahmd please assign this to me?
Thank you for picking up this issue as well! Feel free to ask if there's anything unclear 🙏

instead of above change i think we should change in the prepareNodeForRepeat, while preparing node we can trigger sleep according to exponentialBackoff.

What do you say?
Yes, sounds good to me!

issueDTO.title: Ensure Nullability annotations for ListExtractor.java fields
issueDTO.description:
### Checklist

- [x] I am able to reproduce the bug with the latest version given here: [CLICK THIS LINK](https://github.com/TeamNewPipe/NewPipeExtractor/releases/latest).
- [x] I am aware that this issue is being opened for the NewPipe Extractor, NOT the [app](https://github.com/TeamNewPipe/NewPipe), and my bug report will be dismissed otherwise.
- [x] I made sure that there are *no existing issues* - [open](https://github.com/TeamNewPipe/NewPipeExtractor/issues) or [closed](https://github.com/TeamNewPipe/NewPipeExtractor/issues?q=is%3Aissue+is%3Aclosed) - which I could contribute my information to.
- [x] I have taken the time to fill in all the required details. I understand that the bug report will be dismissed otherwise.
- [x] This issue contains only one bug.
- [x] I have read and understood the [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/TeamNewPipe/NewPipe/blob/dev/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md).

### Affected version

0.24.6

### Steps to reproduce the bug

The [`ListExtractor.java`](https://github.com/TeamNewPipe/NewPipeExtractor/blob/8b9ccec93631191fd39c3d83078dbb6d274883b7/extractor/src/main/java/org/schabi/newpipe/extractor/ListExtractor.java#L1) currently do not expose the nullable fields using `@Nullable` annotations. Some use-sites might be able to get away with using these fields as non-null and lead to crashes, like https://github.com/TeamNewPipe/NewPipe/issues/12401

This could have been caught early on if the `ListExtractor` function correctly indicated the nullable behavior of the returned value. Also, given the app is being rewritten in Kotlin, so the correct annotation would enforce the nullability handling at use-site.



### Expected behavior

The `ListExtractor` shall correctly indicate the Nullable annotation for it's fields

### Actual behavior

_No response_

### Screenshots/Screen recordings

_No response_

### Logs

_No response_

### Additional information

_No response_

issueDTO.title: [Android] Self-hosted SSO login not working
issueDTO.description:
I believe the issue might be with the redirect URI (`https://localhost/auth/oauth2`), which doesn't seem appropriate for an Android application. The app should be using either:
- A custom URL scheme (e.g., `myapp://auth/callback`)
- Android App Links
- The official Android redirect method for OAuth2 (intent filtering)

For example, Immich uses `app.immich:///oauth-callback` as explain in their [docs](https://immich.app/docs/administration/oauth/).

Additional Information:
The authentication flow works fine when using the same Authentik instance with web applications, suggesting the issue is specific to how the Android app handles the OAuth2 flow.

android app: v0.1.37 [app-alpha.apk](https://github.com/donetick/donetick/releases/download/v0.1.37/app-alpha.apk)
external IdP: authentik
comments:
It looks like there's an ENV var for the oauth2 redirect: `DT_OAUTH2_REDIRECT_URL`. Given this seems fairly undocumented at present, so it's unclear if this is a singular value, a comma separated values, or unused, it's difficult to know what a developer should use.

I agree that in general, someone who has control of the IDP, the client app, and the server, should be able to configure auth flows in the way they want. But in the attempt to unblock someone, I'm looking externally at how something like auth0 operates. They have the option to use a webview to maintain a universal session independent of app or web on the same device (in the same default browser), you might consider reviewing auth0's approach to intercepting and consuming web redirects back into your native app, and utilizing that same webview for token refreshes. It may also look something like any cookies set by the donetick webview are sync'd with your app's requests.

this get the url from the window instead of the backend. need to update the [resource](https://github.com/donetick/donetick/blob/main/internal/resource/handler.go#L31-L35) to pass this value and use it there

- instructions for each distro on how to install them (e.g. install via <package manager> , or run in shell <command>)

issueDTO.title: Replace theme assets with SVGs
issueDTO.description:
Tracking the ability to use SVGs for theme assets.

Some related efforts:
* #7667 
* #7708 
* Source artwork for default theme: https://github.com/LMMS/artwork/tree/master/Default%20Theme

Some unresolved issues:
* [x] `embed::getIconPixmap()` quality is ["stuck"](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/dd75605d-4d55-4efc-b6ef-6852c9f3daf4) at an SVGs "natural" resolution.
   * Fixed via #7769

High level tasks: (break these into finer tasks as needed)
* [ ] Switch common assets from `.png` to `.svg`
* [ ] Decide how to handle text (e.g. "ENVELOPE", "LFO")
* [ ] Switch native effects plugins from `.png` to `.svg`
* [ ] Decide how to handle instrument plugins

Initial team (gathered from Discord)
* @StakeoutPunch 
* @rubiefawn  
* @Monospace-V 
* @SpomJ 
* @qnebra 
(this is not exhaustive, anyone feel free to chime in if you can help!)
comments:
So one of the issues discovered in https://github.com/LMMS/lmms/pull/7769 was that most parts of the code use `QPixmap.size()` (`.width()`, `.height()`) to determine how big a UI component is, however with SVGs, the devicePixelRatio causes these values to be multiplied 2x, 3x, 4x, etc.

Qt6 introduced a new `QPixmap::deviceIndependentSize()`, quoting:

> Returns the size of the pixmap in device independent pixels.
> 
> This value should be used when using the pixmap size in user interface size calculations.
> 
> The return value is equivalent to `pixmap.size() / pixmap.devicePixelRatio()`
> 
> This function was introduced in Qt 6.2.

The effect this has on the codebase is evident in #7781 here:

https://github.com/LMMS/lmms/blob/5f5834a7dfab4d433f801acc2a5f45f2d20203c3/src/gui/widgets/Fader.cpp#L83

My recommendation is to provide a QPixmap wrapper class that provide a backport for `deviceIndependentSize` for Qt versions older than 6.2.

# Plugins

If you want to work on any of these, please read the description for #3534 and use it as a reference in your design decisions.

* [x] Amplifier #7770
* [ ] AudioFileProcessor
* [x] Bass Booster #7771
* [ ] BitInvader
* [x] Bitcrush #7772
* [ ] Compressor
* [x] Crossover EQ #7781
* [ ] Delay
* [x] Dispersion #7773
* [x] Dual Filter #7774
* [ ] Dynamics Processor
* [ ] EQ
* [x] Flanger #7775
* [ ] FreeBoy
* [ ] Gig Player
* [ ] Granular Pitch Shifter
* [ ] Kicker
* [ ] LOMM
* [ ] Lb302
* [ ] Monstro
* [ ] Multitap Echo
* [ ] Nes
* [ ] OpulenZ
* [ ] Organic
* [ ] Patman
* [x] Peak Controller #7776
* [x] ReverbSC #7777
* [ ] SoundFont Player
* [ ] Sfxr
* [ ] Sid
* [ ] SlicerT
* [ ] Spectrum Analyzer
* [ ] Stereo Enhancer
* [x] Stereo Matrix #7803
* [ ] Mallets

* [ ] Vectorscope
* [x] VeSTige #7791
* [ ] Vibed
* [ ] Watsyn
* [ ] Waveshaper
* [ ] ZynAddSubFX

issueDTO.title: Recommended to add TG commands: /profit long and /profit short
issueDTO.description:
<!-- 
Note: this section will not show up in the issue.
Have you search for this feature before requesting it? It's highly likely that a similar request was already filed.
-->

## Describe your environment
(if applicable)

* Operating system: Ubuntu 24.04.2
* Python Version: 3.12.3
* CCXT version: 4.4.77
* Freqtrade Version: 2025.4


## Describe the enhancement

Recommended to add TG commands: `/profit long` and `/profit short`

*Explain the enhancement you would like*

Currently, the TG command `/profit` can be used to view the overall trading report. 

However, during trading, we sometimes need to check the long and short reports separately to understand which direction the market is currently favoring.

Could you provide the `/profit long` and `/profit short` commands for this purpose?

Thank you!
comments:
doesn't `/entries` , `/exits` - or `/mix_tags` (obviously assuming the tags in the strategy are set properly) provide you with this information already.

Also - the `/profit` command already has an argument (days) - overloading the same property with assumptions may not be a good idea (from a UX perspective).

What "could" work is having a  `/profit_long` and `/profit_short` command (separate - with the same argument as above) - though i don't really see a necessity for this if i'm honest.

If you think you require this - would you be open to create a Pull Request adding this functionality?

issueDTO.title: [p5.strands] Increasing strands' presence in the reference
issueDTO.description:
### Increasing access

p5.strands is currently undocumented, with only tutorials as learning resources

### Most appropriate sub-area of p5.js?

- [ ] Accessibility
- [ ] Color
- [ ] Core/Environment/Rendering
- [ ] Data
- [ ] DOM
- [ ] Events
- [ ] Image
- [ ] IO
- [ ] Math
- [ ] Typography
- [ ] Utilities
- [x] WebGL
- [ ] Build process
- [ ] Unit testing
- [ ] Internationalization
- [ ] Friendly errors
- [x] Other (specify if possible)

### Feature enhancement details

p5.strands requires more thorough documentation so that it's more discoverable and understandable. The idea is to add p5.strands examples to the reference in places which currently have GLSL examples (keeping them side by side to show both work). 

For example:
- [p5.Shader.modify](https://beta.p5js.org/reference/p5.shader/modify/)
- [setUniform](https://beta.p5js.org/reference/p5.shader/setuniform/)
- [filter](https://beta.p5js.org/reference/p5/filter/)

Additional examples could be added to _any_ WebGL functions, including primitive shapes like [box](https://beta.p5js.org/reference/p5/box/).
comments:
Hi @lukeplowden, first off, hats-off for the brilliant work on p5.strands! I have a small (very silly) question.
The `filter()` function in p5.js typically relies on its own built-in GLSL shaders. When you mention adding examples for p5.strands under `filter()`, do you mean writing a custom shader that leverages strands internally and showcasing that, and then using `filter()` function in the whole sketch created? I???m not quite sure how best to place strands examples inside the `filter()` reference?

In short, are you thinking creating sketches using p5.Strands and then using `filter()`?

> In short, are you thinking creating sketches using p5.Strands and then using `filter()`?

I think so, to give users another potential way to discover strands (through looking up `filter`) in the examples.

There's a potential separate task we could do in the future where we replace the internal filter implementations with p5.strands versions, but I'll save that for a different issue 🙂
